Name: Victor Biko
Business Description:
WHY POULTRY FARM?_x000D_
There are quite a great number of things that are highly needed by man as a nutritious source of food that is gotten from the poultry .This is accompanied with the growing demand in our economy. Therefore taking advantage of the existing opportunity to satisfy the demanding population will help the business to sustain itself financially without depending on other external sources of financing within a short period of time ._x000D_
Through the experience and agricultural trainings I have attended has provided me. With enough knowledge to and skills to manage the business .I believe it can be an open way to create employment opportunities for other youths through it’s future  expansion._x000D_
It is for this reason that it can be said that poultry business has come to stay .  _x000D_
Business Customers:
•	Targeted market- Naturally the target market are those who are the end consumers of _x000D_
    Commercial Poultry farm produce and also who benefit from the business  value chain of the poultry farming and eggs production industry is all encompassing .it’s far-reaching ._x000D_
Every household consumes produce from the commercial Poultry farm be it chicken or egg. So also almost all hotels and fast restaurants sell chicken and eggs .In essence a commercial Poultry should be able to sell his or her chicken and eggs to as many people as possible._x000D_
_x000D_
In view of that I have positioned the business to attract consumers of chicken and eggs not just in Mombasa alone but also other counties like kilifi and kwale. I have conducted my market research and survey and I will ensure that I meet and surpass the business expectations I set for the business ._x000D_
Below is a list of people and business that I will market my chickens and eggs to ._x000D_
1.	Households_x000D_
2.	Individuals_x000D_
3.	Hotels_x000D_
4.	Fast food eateries _x000D_
5.	Restaurants _x000D_
6.	Agricultural merchants _x000D_
Product Solution:
taking advantage of the existing opportunity to satisfy the demanding population will help the business to sustain itself financially without depending on other external sources of financing within a short period of time ._x000D_
Through the experience and agricultural trainings I have attended has provided me. With enough knowledge to and skills to manage the business .I believe it can be an open way to create employment opportunities for other youths through it’s future  expansion._x000D_
It is for this reason that it can be said that poultry business has come to stay .  _x000D_
Business Challenge: Economic closure due to covid 19 ,Hiking prices of feed  and chicks with high demand from the ground making it difficult for one to secure regular order .Lack of standard prices of selling my products hence experiencing loss in the business when we'll calculation is done to determine profit for the business .
Programme Benefit: Training to get exposed to more skills on entreprenuership and learning much things from youths in terms entrepreneurial culture .Having a gate way to showcase what am doing to invite more customers and people who may like to invest in it .
Reffered By: Facebook post, From National Youth Council, Online Search (ie Google), Word of Mouth
Programme Participation: Have person on the ground particularly in villages to teach the youth how your prepared to empower the youths and programs you have in place to implement for the youths.
Engamenet Ways: Voluntary work, Internships and work placements, Training
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Civic Engagement, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Health, Environment, Technology, Manufacturing, Agriculture, Education
Programme Measures: Having representative on the ground to show case what you want to do for the youth and the procedures of registering in such programs to ensure maximum participation

Name: IBRAHIM FADHILI
Field Interested: Skills Development, Value Character Development, Drug & Crime Free, Health, Technology, Education
Business Description:
My business is still an idea yet to be implemented and will be more like a Youth empowerment group in our area and hence will broaden out according to my speculation of how things are and technology is and is becoming in the future._x000D_
these are the products offered:_x000D_
1.Training of Soft skills Boot camps and perfections platforms for example in my society back home there is a friction of Software skills, there are lesser training institutions and as tech is consuming the worlds economy vastly there is need for software skills to survive in our current economy state and we can come up with programs for perfection then offer certificates from beginner level to advanced._x000D_
2.Organizing drug and substance abuse talks. For instance, youth in our community finish school and get wasted on drugs. Most of their time is wasted on drugs and leisure(when they should be doing something constructive). Imani group will reach pout to them in talks and offer counselling and rehabilitation sessions._x000D_
3.For the smart brains students and brave enough we will be offering COMPETITIPONS(contest like) and so they pay for them to participate, the best is prized. This will improve competition among schools and hence improve number of graduates_x000D_
4. Come up with Career talks for the form four leavers and high school students set to their journey in the professional fields for them to know what to do or expect never for them to regret having a degree or certificate and perceiving it as a "FASHION'_x000D_
5. My speculation is that the business will grow after sometime slow but steady trusting the process. We will be offering Platforms for young entrepreneurs to present their ideas and fund them where possible.
Business Customers:
1.My business will be able to serve Schools students especially Campuses and High Schools in Motivational talks, Trainings of software skills and Self development._x000D_
2.Will also be able to serve civilians: those wishing to specialize in soft skills eg Microsoft Packages,  Ethical Hacking, Business Administration ideas_x000D_
3.My business will also be reaching to Youths who are down in life e.g. physically , emotionally and financially_x000D_
4.It'll be also reach to Orphans by encouraging them not to give up in life and that there future like any other person is bright_x000D_
Product Solution:
The product will solve problems like:_x000D_
1.Getting software skills at a higher price_x000D_
2.Lack of employment for youths since from the soft skills one can set up a business and develop himself_x000D_
3.Crime in the society since from the drug and substance talks. Youths will be motivated to stop drugs hence reducing idleness reducing crime in the society_x000D_
4.Idea dying just in the mind since from the platforms and coaching this will be solved_x000D_
Business Challenge:
My business is not yet launched. Its still an idea to be implemented this year as I said to uplift youths in the society in life._x000D_
My problem is getting mentors and a team which will mentor me further and support me in coming up with ideas._x000D_
I'm a problem solver but without necessary efficient support and mentoring I'm less.
Programme Benefit:
I would like to equip myself with skills and know how to go about when looking for other efficient team members_x000D_
I would also like to get support financially to help register my group and advertising our products thereafter

1.Come up with websites and online pages for encouraging youth ideas presentations_x000D_
2.Carrying out rallies for youth empowerment_x000D_

Business Description: currently, I run a cyber services shop (cyber cafe) whose services include the provision of internet services, phone repairs and network unlocking, computer repair and maintenance, and graphic and web design. that being said our bigger picture is to tap into the music and film industry by producing local music and making music videos for local up-and-coming artists, we also have talented screenwriters whose talents we are willing to explore more with short films first and eventually mainstream movies.

Name: Hamisi Thuva Salim
Business Description: The business entails establishment of an innovative agricultural system which will integrate fish farming, chicken rearing and vegetable crop farming in a local made green house. The system will be known as VESAKU SYSTEM. The green house will be constructed using palstic bottles and the farming will be aquaponic culture where their will be a symbiotic relationship. The system will make agriculture attractive to youth, conserve the environmental by reducing the menace of plastic bottles in our environment, nutritional well-being and balanced diet to most families, economic sustainability, employment opportunities,inland blue economy venture and will be an economic recovery strategy from the effects of covid 19. The business will ensure food security, clean environment from plastic bottles threat. When the green house is slight modified it can serve as a house.
Business Customers:
The business will serve the youth and make them venture into agriculture because it is soil less farming._x000D_
The community members who will be coming to buy fish, eggs, chicken and vegetables._x000D_
The community coming to learn as it is a learning hub for agriculture practice._x000D_
It will also serve the communities and farmers looking for cheap greenhouses as it will be providing solution.
Product Solution:
The business will solve the problems of_x000D_
1. Poverty, it will create employment and ensure growth o economy._x000D_
2. overdependence on rain use farming which has made it difficult to produce year round._x000D_
3. The menace of plastic bottles which is really annoying, the business uses the plastic bottles to construct greenhoues thus ensuring utilization and recycling._x000D_
4. Youth relactancy in agriculture, youth have been regarding agriculture as dirty because of the soil but this business will be soil less thus attracting youth._x000D_
5. With little modifications the greenhouses can be used as houses thus creating an opportunity for cheap housing._x000D_
6. The effects of  covid 19 has great affected the economy the entry of this business will be a recovery pathway._x000D_
7. Food insecurity due to prolonged droughts have seen famine strike our country the business will ensure harvesting all year round with fish, chicken and vegetables available._x000D_
8. Nutritional health problems due to lack of balanced diet in our daily food on the tables but the system will ensure that various proteins and vitamins will be available by fish, vegetables, eggs and chicken produced in the system._x000D_
NB. VESAKU system when it enters the market it can be legendary achievement as it touhes on 3 of the big 4 agenda set out by the president. That is blue economy, food security and afforadale housing._x000D_
_x000D_

Name: ATHUMAN KOMORA GARISSE
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Technology, Manufacturing, Education
Business Description:
Malindi interactive Services presents an idea for a social enterprise; Malindi Youth Business Hub, which is a two window business idea. _x000D_
First, Malindians Interactive Services also referred to as "Malindians" is an information portal for the town of Malindi providing information about Malindi for tourists visiting the town. It features tourist facilities - hotels & accommodation, restaurants & cafés, bars, and clubs, culture, and other attractions. It is a youth-driven platform that showcases and tells the stories of the people of Malindi, the Malindians. _x000D_
Our second program is the Malindi Business & Art Exhibition (MBAE). MBAE is a program to train, support, incubate and empower young people in business to access markets. Our target sectors include fine art, beadwork, carvings, crafts, print fashion (T-shirts, Kangas, bandanas), and e-commerce. The program in particular targets single mothers and idle young men susceptible to radicalization and drug abuse.  _x000D_
Business Customers:
Our primary target for the tourist platform is the local tourist seeking a holiday destination and a memorable experience. Naturally, the international tourist is our secondary market as it is still attractive. _x000D_
For the exhibition, we target local residents in Malindi, Kilifi, Mombasa, tourists, and businesses across the country.
Product Solution:
We recognize that the unemployment problem is created by reduced tourist numbers in Malindi. The hub retrains the youth, generates value by creating employment for skilled youth in the town, supports business start-ups in the area through the exhibition, driving tourists (especially local tourists) to Malindi. These benefits will create a ripple effect in the economy of the town; salvage families, reduce crime rates, discourage the allure of radicalization and help eliminate drug abuse. _x000D_
Our unique strategy in attaining this is the use of innovative technology platforms to disseminate information and capture a market.  _x000D_
Business Challenge:
1. Little capital injection in the business thus far_x000D_
2. Corona Virus (Covid-19) global effects
Programme Benefit: Provision of seed funding, capacity development( Training ad incubation) and network development
Programme Participation: 1. Improve visibility. Very few youths know of the existence of the National Youth Council
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Health, Environment, Technology, Manufacturing, Education
Programme Measures:
1. Awareness of programs run by the National Youth Council_x000D_
2. Involvement of all key youth organizations and players_x000D_
3. curation of relevant programs to spur growth with the youth

Name: Gift Mwandawiro
Business Description: My business deals with sell of green groceries such as vegetables eg Sukuma wiki, Spinach, Coriander, Green peppers, capsicum,Managu and pigweed, All this in a small kitchen garden in our home
Business Customers: My business has a broad range of customers, both young and old can consume my products as they are of nutritive benefit to all people
Product Solution: First and foremost, especially in the urban sector, study has shown that many people are consuming poisonous products from groceries due to unhealthy practices used to grow these products, a major one being use of excessive fertilizers, dirty water from sewage outlets for irrigation.This has posed a serious challenge to the health of consumers and caused diseases such as cancer, stomach ulcers due to toxic chemicals in sewage water , herbicides and fertilizer.As I use indegenous methods to boost soil fertility eg use of cow dung ,and other environmental friendly herbicides, non of my customers has so far complained of any defect caused by my products
Business Challenge: Lack of modern technology such as machines for irrigation and also water storage tanks to store water for irrigation.Secondly as I deal with highly perishable products, I have no modern storage facilities such as refrigerator to maintain the quality of the product, thus sometimes they go bad leading to huge losses.
Programme Benefit: I need to have support for input such as advanced technology farm tools ,eg watering pipes, automatic water sprinklers, This will simplify my work hence maximizing on production leading to high yield hence good profit.I also need modern technology storage facilities eg refrigerator to store my products.

Name: Vicglenn Munene
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Technology
Business Description: We provide an opportunity for young people to use their skills in gaming inorder to earn a living.This is possible through our application network which connects gamers across the world that allows for peer to peer competitive video gaming.Our business model allows gamers to leverage their expertise and skills in video games to compete against gamers across the globe.If they win,they keep 90% of the capital raised.Our application network is compatible with PlayStation,Xbox,Android,ios and computers.It is also important to note that this is a new and innovation idea and we plan to capitalize on the advantage of the first mover.
Business Customers:
The young generation._x000D_
This includes young adolescents,the youth and young adults._x000D_
Majority of youth love to spend their free time in gaming activities.With the recent technological advancement,there is increased demand for video games.Our research shows that  50% of the  kenyan youth are involved in video gaming activities._x000D_
In a
Product Solution:
We believe our service will jumpstart the gaming industry in kenya and subsequently the entire continent.This is because we aim to rewrite peoples perspective on gaming,that it is not only a form of entertainment,but also a means to earn a living.The video game industry was worth over 90 billion dollars in 2020._x000D_
_x000D_
We also aim to increase awareness on  esports._x000D_
E sports is a fast growing,major money making world of competitive video gaming.This is evident in the recent eWorld cup competitions which were held online._x000D_
_x000D_
The problem of unemployment has devastated our country for years.Our solution to this problem is simple yet effective.Most young people are equipped with many skills, however there are few opportunities to utilize this skills inorder to earn income.Our model allows the youth to utilize their skills in video gaming to earn income.It connects them to other gamers across the globe._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

Name: Nicholas Karani Mwenda
Business Description:
Comrades Digital Mall Ltd is a registered e-commerce company positioning itself to become the market leader in offering high school students an online in-house shopping solution for everything they consume daily, packaged exactly how they need it, when they need it, and at a price they can afford. _x000D_
The company offers a wide range of quality products such as personal effects (Toothbrush and Toothpaste, Bathing Soap, Washing Soap and Powder, Towel, Metallic Washing Buckets, Tissue Rolls, Sanitary Towels, Hair Combs, Hand Mirrors, Slippers, Shoe Polish), Stationeries (Pens and Pencils, notebooks, Geometrical Sets, Scientific Calculators, Set Books), Schoolbags, Face Masks, Uniforms, Mattresses, Dictionaries, Kamusi, Four Figure Mathematical Tables, Photocopy Papers (Ream) Belts, Exams, Text Books, and Chain-links among others. _x000D_
Having been created for a comrade by a comrade, the company uses the knowledge gained from studying the everyday behavior of this market niche to provide quality products and services that guarantee customer satisfaction._x000D_
Business Customers: Millions of high students in Kenyan Secondary Boarding Schools, their parents, and Teachers
Product Solution:
Imagine all the struggles and troubles these young high school students have to go through every time schools are opening. Having to carry with themselves very bulky shopping bags in this very undisciplined matatu industry on their way to school is never an easy task. In several instances, students have ended up losing their valuable items or having their shopping vandalized while on transit as conductors focus on maximizing profits on every route covered. _x000D_
On the other hand, how hectic is the process of inspecting hundreds of luggage's on the reporting date? With the Corona Pandemic, this process has become not only tiresome but also risky. Remember, students come across different surfaces and routes on their way to school. And having in mind that an inspection has to be conducted at the gate, this practice exposes the teaching and non-teaching staff to the dangers of contracting the virus._x000D_
Lastly, how often have students got exposed to drugs, injuries, and other dangers outside the school environment while on permission to restock their shopping? Although this issue is more common in boys' schools, it is a challenge that needs to be addressed. The parents have put 100% trust in the school management to safeguard the students while under their custody. But is there any wrong with allowing students out to restock their shopping for a comfortable stay in school? Definitely not. But it is from such doings that some managements have found themselves under so much pressure when certain right decisions result in unanticipated outcomes._x000D_
Therefore, our business seeks to address some of the above challenges. Through our online platform, students no longer have to worry about bulky luggage's on their school opening dates, teaching and non-teaching staff no longer have to worry about the hectic inspection process and the Corona Virus contracting risk while parents will have a 100% assurance that their students are in school full time until the official breaking dates.

Programme Benefit:

Name: Kelvin Mutea Kigunda
Business Description:
BACKGROUND ON THE BUSINESS_x000D_
Since the start of Covid, my partners and I have been buying fresh vegetables from the agriculturally rich regions that are close to Nairobi (areas like Kiambu) and delivering them directly to homes in gated communities within Nairobi. This was initially supposed to be a temporary side hustle to cushion us from the adverse economic effects brought about by COVID-19. However of late we have come to the realization that we could enhance the nascent supply chain that we already have and blend it with Technology to not only reach a bigger customer but to also help Farmers get a read market for their produce._x000D_
_x000D_
DEVELOPMENT OF AN F2K APP. (farm to kitchen)_x000D_
F2K App will be a mobile based application that will enable people in affluent suburbs within Nairobi to get Fresh produce straight from the farm, directly into their Kitchens within 24 hours. For example, a client in Runda will be able to request for fresh cabbages. The cabbages are then bought from farmer in Meru and then delivered to the customer in 24 hours.
Business Customers:
Our business will serve 2 groups:_x000D_
1) FARMERS- These are small scale farmers who grow perishable fruits and vegetables as the primary source of their livelihood._x000D_
_x000D_
2) UP-MARKET FRESH PRODUCE CONSUMERS- These are the people who live in the affluent regions of Nairobi and who procure their fresh produce mostly from supermarkets.
Product Solution:
Our business will essentially solve specific problems for the  2 groups that it will be serving:_x000D_
1) FARMERS- Our business will enable farmers to get a market for their perishable produce and reduce the number of middle men involved within the fresh produce supply chain._x000D_
_x000D_
2) UP-MARKET FRESH PRODUCE CONSUMERS- Buying of stale vegetables and fruits from supermarkets has been a common occurrence for people within Nairobi's suburbs. This is a problem that our platform intends to solve.
Business Challenge: Lack of funds to build the IT platform which can in turn help us to not only reach more customers but to also create a sustainable business out of the same.
Programme Benefit: I have enrolled in this programme because i am trying to raise capital that will enable me to not only build the IT platform on which the entire idea will ride on, but to also create an effective supply chain that enables delivery of fresh produce directly from the farm, to kitchen in under 24 hours.
Programme Participation: The NYC could become much more involved in creating social events that encourage a discussion on the Youth Initiatives.
Programme Measures: The use of an integrated database on all the existing youth groups could greatly help coordinate youth initiatives.

Name: Kenton Mutethia Muthaura
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Education
Business Description:
Our Youths for the Boy Child Organization (YBCO) came up with an Apprenticeship Program dubbed Unshod College to benefit the Youth Drop-outs in our community in the move to provide them with technical skills and offer employment to them through our partner companies._x000D_
To achieve this our NGO has therefore partnered with various Companies in the technical field who are therefore working with our drop-outs for 3-6months to give them these technical skills.During the 3-6months program our apprentices get a daily pay of Ksh 400 as a facilitation fee and after graduating,they get a pay of Ksh 800 in a day and be absorbed to work with our partners wherever they've been awarded contracts._x000D_
This has helped us solve the unemployment crisis, reduce the overall lethargy as well as societal vices.This program is also transforming the lives of these youths plus those of their immediate families through their earnings and this is positively contributing towards economic growth.
Business Customers: Our program is working towards benefiting the youths who dropped out of school back in the days due to lack of fees and family related issues.The program is also aimed at giving them the technical skills while they get paid even during the training period and thereafter they get absorbed by our partner companies for employment on the contracts they've tendered.
Product Solution:
Overall lethargy,societal vices and dependency on the societal working class is all issues facing our drop-outs today in our societies.Empowering them with the much needed technical skills while offering them daily wages is one way to transform their lives and give them the sole reason to embrace these technical fields._x000D_
By networking them with our partners and ensuring they get absorbed to work with them in all the contracts our partners gets,will not only help us shape their lives for better but also reduce the poverty level at grassroot levels._x000D_
Business Challenge: Inadequate capital to scale up this idea so as to benefit more and more drop-outs who are showing up to embrace the program has been the biggest challenge.We've seen overwhelming numbers hence overstretching out partner companies who are working with us in realizing this dream by giving them more numbers than they can handle.We're therefore looking for more partnerships to ensure these large numbers have got companies to absorb them while they get paid their stipends in time.
Programme Benefit: Am looking forward to growing my network which is my networth.By doing so I believe I will be able to connect with the like-minded people and companies that will be ready to support my idea and contribute positively in impacting the lives of our youth drop-outs.
Reffered By: Referred by someone, From National Youth Council, Online Search (ie Google)
Programme Participation: By having strong county chapters that will be sharing the NYC opportunities will be a nice way to help youths see the need to participate in the youth initiatives around.This will serve as a motivation for the your to join.The NYC also needs to come up with sensitization programs to help youths understand what they do so that even as they participate they are aware what the NYC entails.
Engamenet Ways: Voluntary work, Internships and work placements, Training
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Education
Programme Measures: Strengthen the county chapters and financially support them to run sensitization programs on youth initiatives and opportunities available.

Name: MORRIS MUNYI
Business Description:
I buy indeginous food products, more specifically cassava from the market or farmers and do value addition then hawk them, which includes:_x000D_
cleaning and boiling them till fully cooked. i then dip them in a pre-mixed wheat paste made of wheat flour, colouring, salt and sugar then instantly dip them into the cooking oil._x000D_
on average, cassavas worth KES 50 can give me a net profit of KES 150._x000D_
the problem is that preparing the product by use of wood and charcoal is a huge environmental hazard, and highly inefficient, limiting my production capacity. with a funding of kes 60,000 i will purchase a deep frying machine, cut the environmental effect of charcoal use, produce higher quality products, produce more output, rent a stationed production place by renting a business operations room and create much required employment for myself and other youths whom i intend to be my employees.
Business Customers: my business will serve the general public,from whom the demand is already overwhelming. i deliver to some employees within offices in town already, and several business people around kiambuthi and along my path._x000D_
Product Solution: the problem of higher demand than supply will be solved since i can produce more. as well, some people to whom i cant deliver in the morning hours for breakfast due to reduced speed of cooking will be able to acquire it, since much of the time-consuming labour will be eliminated. this also applies to some customers who ask to carry the snack in the morning because they work outside my radius.
Business Challenge: besides curent weather conditions and unreliability due to the mobile nature of my sales(hawking), the biggest challenge is undersupply of the product. this needs funding, which i cannot access through a bank loan since i just finished school in april and my savings account does not qualify for one yet
Programme Benefit: i hope to have not just financial capital and/or investors but also a network from interacting with the stakeholders and generally those running the program, and hope to inswpire another young or vulnerable person in turn some day_x000D_
Programme Participation: there could be established a central information system or platform for kenyan youth. they need to be encouraged to not just take advantage of these programs and projects but also share Youth-to Youth about them. this will help more youth and encourage involvement in these projects.

Other Platforms: social media platforms, twitter, facebook,linkedin, etc.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement, Environment, Manufacturing, Agriculture

Name: VIOLA WAKIO
Business Description:
Fighting climate change with transparent climate offset. In order to limit and avoid the worst possible outcomes of climate change scientists predict that we need to limit the rise in global temperature._x000D_
This means reducing our greenhouse gases emissions and becoming carbon neutral. Unfortunately, not all companies have the capacity  or tech to run their own carbon neutral programs. But by purchasing climate credits and offsets, all companies have an opportunity to become carbon neutral. Product certification can then be displayed on packages and in advertising which can be a big market boom for any carbon neutral business.
Business Customers: Individuals and companies who are environment conscious.
Product Solution: The fact that not all companies have the capacity and tech to run their own carbon negative program. We do that for them in exchange of climate credits and offsets certifications which are very vital in tracking their carbon footprint offset and it's a good marketing strategy especially for exporting companies bearing in mind that everyone is shifting their priority to a more safe planet free from greenhouse gases I.e product certification can be displayed on packages.
Business Challenge:
Capital _x000D_
Marketing strategy
Programme Benefit:
Training_x000D_
Mentorship_x000D_
Monetary
Programme Participation: Focus on areas where youths are vested eg institutions of higher learning, involve them in the process and the different programs available.
Programs Interested: Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Civic Engagement, Creative Economy, Environment, Technology, Agriculture

Business Description: Badgers Mbeere Pure Honey specializes in commercial production of honey and honey products. The business takes advantage of the vast unoccupied lands in the lower parts of Mbeere where hives have been mounted in the bushes to harness honey from the housed swarms. After harvesting , honey is processed by means of extracting the honey from the honey combs and packaged for distribution. Currently , the project reaches local customers but there are plans to expand the project to reach consumers beyond the locality. This is a phase that will be preceded by first aligning the product as per KEBS standards, and consequently, licensing . The honey combs are also sold to pharmaceutical companies. The project initially employs only three persons but it is aimed at employing more locals through recruiting them into production of the honey thus generating income for the community at large.
Business Customers: Many of us enjoy honey and incorporate it into our daily diet, whether as a natural sugar substitute for our coffee or simply as a sweet treat. But specific honey varietals known as “active” honeys have also been utilized throughout history for their antibacterial and medicinal properties. Honeys presenting unique antibacterial properties are found across different geographic regions around the world from Malaysia and Chile, to Yemen in the Middle-East. Active honeys are characterized by the existence of bio-active compounds found within them. Hydrogen peroxide is one of its bio-active compounds which has shown effectiveness as an antibacterial agent. However, active honeys can also be influenced by additional factors such as osmotic pressure, pH and the presence of other phenolic compounds.Health benefits such as anti-inflammatory, anti-allergenic, antioxidant and antimicrobial properties are attributable to these phenolic compounds.1 As technology and analytics for laboratory testing has improved in recent times, we now have a better understanding of the nature of these bio-active components, where they originate from and how they enable us to use honey as a medicine.In the era of “Super bugs” and bacteria which seem to be outpacing the production of new and effective antibiotics, the efficacy of natural alternatives is being closely examined. This has also included discovering the medical uses of honey —particularly for wound care. High grade honey can be used to impregnate medical dressings for advanced wound care. These have shown positive results against aggressive skin infections, specifically Methicillin Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA).
Product Solution: The product is bout to provide a wide range of nutrients in the consumers not forgetting the many health benefits tied to the use of honey. Honey is used in the treatment of eye diseases, bronchial asthma, throat infections, tuberculosis, thirst, hiccups, fatigue, dizziness, hepatitis, constipation, worm infestation, piles, eczema, healing of ulcers, and wounds.
Business Challenge:
Finances-to be able to produce sufficient honey, capital is required in the initial set up of the hives, training the handlers, processing and distribution. _x000D_
In addition, the huge amount of money required to obtain a standardization permit is in a way affecting sales since it is a prerequisite for products on the shelves in big retail shops despite the product being purely agricultural. _x000D_
Marketing- there has been an influx of impure and adulterated honey in the market, thus building a reputed brand is definitely posing a challenge.
Programme Benefit:
Training for effective start up_x000D_
Financial support for effective take off, since the project is almost stalling at start-up
Programme Participation:
information sharing_x000D_
increased incentives_x000D_
facilitate start up of the economically viable projects and business ideas presented to them
Programme Measures: appoint youth ambassadors at sub county level

Name: Stephen Mue Keli
Business Description: I deal in Vegetable and fruit irrigation. Mainly for local selling in the nearest homesteads, markets and the towns near my local area. I plant the vegetables in an area of about two hundred square meters. The vegetables I grow are ,kales, spinach, mchicha, chillies, tomatoes,onions,dania, capsicum, some water melons and oassion fruits. I also grow some other fruita but in a  small scale such as pawpaws and mangoes. I make quite some appreciable profits with minimum losses. The losses mostly incured are from birds, monkeys and squirrels eating the capsicum, melons,tomatoeas and pawpaws. Tje input into the farm include fertilizers,seeds,manure from goat,chicken and cow dung, and some spraying chemicals such as sulban,moltifax from OSHO company. This is a business I started a year ago and am currently running it through two employees who run the business while am in school. The Business is currently doing great. Some of the challenges that i face is mostly finacial. Buying the farm inputs sometimes is a great struggle to me as am still in school and want to invest as early as I am.
Business Customers:
1.The local homesteads- Roughly three hundred homesteads._x000D_
2. The local schools as i distibute some kales and spinach._x000D_
3.The nearby market places._x000D_
4. The 'vibanda' salespeople in the market places_x000D_
Product Solution:
'- The problem of travelling long distances in search of vegetables as I avail them in their doorsteps._x000D_
- The problem of depending on one source of vegetablea such as cabbage to supplement the diets by providing the 'greens' to them._x000D_

Business Description: My business is a poultry business. I deal with ducks and chicken. The products I have include Ducks, duck meat, marinated duck meat, duck eggs, ducklings, chicken and chicken eggs.
Business Customers: The customers of these products are currently households. I also serve other farmers who want to start duck farming. In the future after I have increased production, the intended customers are supermarkets and restaurants. The business will serve those who seek to diversify the food consumption as I will be able to offer a new meat product which is not very common in Kenya. The business will also serve tourists and expatriates who are looking for duck meat as they used to consume in their home countries. My business will also serve consumer of only white meat.
Product Solution: I will solve the problem of lack of diversity in meat products available in the Kenyan market. I will also be able to provide white meat products for customers who only consume white meat. I will also be able to provide eggs,chicks and ducklings to customers who want to start their own farmers. I will also solve the problem that expatriates may have in trying to access food like in their own country. I will also be able to provide a unique product to consumers which is the marinated duck meat.
Business Challenge: My biggest challenge is being able to expand my market to the rest of the country. This is because of unavailability of safe transport and delivery services for food product from outside Nairobi. This affects to fully take advantage of the market opportunities in the rest of the country.

Name: Kelvin Njoroge
Business Description:
Hermes is an online supermarket shopping and delivery application primarily built for Android. _x000D_
The user downloads the application, creates an account, logs in, shops, pays - through MPESA, paypal or crypto currency and the goods are delivered at their preferred pick up point.
Business Customers: Hermes is aimed at serving anyone who is 18 years and above with a smartphone or internet connection. This is due to the fact that the smartphone market and internet usage has been on the rise in Kenya.
Product Solution:
1. Congestion is supermarkets as it will ease queues._x000D_
2. Time - users will be able to use the time spent going to the supermarket, shopping, queuing, paying and going back to accomplish more meaningful economic building activities._x000D_
3. Aide in the government's efforts in curbing the spread of COVID-19 as social distancing will be implemented by default as the application is online._x000D_
4. Enable users to manage their budget as their transactions will be logged._x000D_
5. Supermarkets will benefit from having an active inventory management system as the application will be able to keep track of how many goods have been sold and how many need restocking._x000D_
6. Supermarkets will also increase the sales of supermarkets as many people will be able to shop._x000D_
7. Increase in employment opportunities as shoppers and delivery people will be hired to compliment the existing service members.
Business Challenge: Our biggest challenge is acceptance from the Supermarket industry as they already have an established way of doing things and transitioning to digital services seems to be an issue.
Programme Benefit:
1. Networks and linkages in the supermarket industry to facilitate the adoption of Hermes._x000D_
2. Financial support to increase the manpower to develop, sustain & market the application._x000D_
3. Training on business management.

Name: Samwel Nganga Kariuki
Business Description: The business Is based on technology in agricultural practices. this is through substitution of the old farm maintenance technologies with the use of a fully autonomous agricultural drone. The drone is equipped with sensors and different hardware capable of spraying, sowing and fertilizer spreading and in special cases carry out soil profiling and crop count to determine the percentage of crop germination. The drone has been found to be a good tool for reclamation of farming land as it can work on all terrain as well as all weather. It has also proven to be a good tool for forest land reclamation as it is capable of spreading tree seeds over large areas and in a very short duration of time.
Business Customers: The business serves both small scale and large scale farmers as it is capable of operating on both large and small farms effectively and efficiently. Under special cases the drone can also be used to serve institutions such as the agriculture research institute and Kenya wildlife services to monitor and minimize human wildlife conflicts eg by throwing pepper balls on elephants to prevent them from entering into peoples farms and also as a tool for tree seeds sowing in order to increase the forest cover.
Product Solution:
The previous farm maintenance systems are affected by terrain, height of the crops as well as weather. example a tractor sprayer cannot work on marshy ground as it will get stuck on the mud. this system is also not suitable for small farms._x000D_
 similarly, the motorized sprayer carried by human is tiresome and thus not appropriate for large scale farms. these systems are also affected by the time of day, the height of the crops and the weather. Tall crops such as maize are hard to spray once they go beyond the knee height._x000D_
The two systems are not economical as they require alot of input in terms of pesticides and other inputs, time and money. They are also not environmentally friendly as they produce alot of smoke which adds to the carbon footprint in the atmosphere. _x000D_
The drone therefore is there to solve all the above, where it will work on both small scale and large scale farms, saving hugely on pesticides and other inputs as well as reduce significantly the amount of time required to spray or carry other farm maintenance practices. It will not be affected by the height of the crop as it flies above them with ease, neither will it be affected by the time of day or the weather. The terrain and obstacles will also not affect it as it will be fitted with terrain radars to ensure a safe operational distance from obstacles and an inclining ground.
Business Challenge: Lack of finances to help in implementing the drone. A prototype is already in place and used in testing but the complete system is not yet implemented due to lack of funds.
Specify 36: I have been a member of an incubation hub by the name Kenya Climate Innovation Centre at strathmore university. The hub has played a key role in offering training on business management and mentorship programs
Programme Benefit: I would really hope to get some financial assistance to implement on the system, because i know and believe that it will be of great help and a major step towards developing the agriculture sector.
Programme Participation: Have a few youths in the cabinet to represent the others. that way, the nyc will be giving a gesture of good will to the youths and it will be a  major step in capturing their attention.
Engamenet Ways: Voluntary work, Internships and work placements

Name: Mwangi Erastus

Name: Yvonne Wambui Mwangi
Business Description:
We haven't launched a business yet, just started by writing up a business plan. The business, YNE, is supposed to cater to the Digital community and their needs. Everything from developing Websites, designing Posters, Brochures, Book Covers, Business Cards, Business Heads and even Business Logos. _x000D_
_x000D_
The pandemic taught us something: that most people can work from home simply by using the internet. And Businesses today, now understand that their customers can be found online, because that is where they spend most of their time. This is where we come in: we fill in that space by making ourselves available to meet that need: help find, reach and bring in their customers using the Digital Space. How? By building interactive and engaging websites for them, as well as creating graphic designs for businesses that wish to capture the audiences attention. _x000D_
_x000D_
Of course, we plan on augmenting our services by using top notch applications and software. However, today, to get quality Graphic Design software, a purchase needs to be done. And its not cheap. And to build the type of websites we wish to create will also take a certain amount of investment in software and better functioning computers.. Funds to invest in our business idea has been the biggest challenge in moving forward._x000D_
_x000D_
We also recognized another niche: the Video era. From YouTube and TikTok videos to Instagram reels, we are surrounded by visual content. And businesses also need to tap into that to reach and interact with their customers. We come in and provide video editing services for those that lack the time to do so. But that also requires a top functioning video editor that can withstand large files and perform numerous functions. This has also been another factor hindering our progress.
Business Customers: It will serve the Businesses that need to reach their customers via an online platform. It also caters to those companies looking to build a digital online presence. This is through video editing, website and graphic design.
Product Solution: The number one problem our business is designed to solve is the lack of time companies today lack in building an online presence to reach their audience. We fill that gap by doing the nitty gritty of building an enviable online presence for our clients so they can have time to do the big stuff.
Business Challenge: Lack of funds
Programme Benefit:
I read that the program offers Entrepreneurship classes, and I think we could benefit greatly from it. Entrepreneurship is a new field for us, and learning how to navigate it will no doubt help us grow, augment our profit and revenue and even learn how to stay ahead of competition. _x000D_
_x000D_
Recently, I learned that the most important aspect of a business is sales or the ability to sell something to someone else. One can't make profit from their services or products if they have no idea how to put them up on the market and sell it to the people. So, perhaps this would also be a part of the Entrepreneurship classes. _x000D_
_x000D_
Another reason is to be able to financial support. This will help us get on our two feet as a business by setting up shop and purchasing the, hardware, software and applications that we require for the business. _x000D_
_x000D_
In summary, we require support through the provision of intellectual knowledge and monetary value.
Programme Participation:
Perhaps increase awareness of the program. Today's youth spend very little time watching news or even the TV. But you will find them on YouTube and Instagram. Perhaps advertising on these platforms would help increase your reach._x000D_
_x000D_
Have influencers talking about the program as well. Social Media Influencers have been able to garner enough influence by building a relationship of trust with their followers. Leveraging their ability to influence to reach the youth can go a long way.
Programme Measures:
Communication is key to enhancing co-ordination among the Youth. I'm alluding to effective communication, where people are taught how to listen first, before speaking. Or rather, taught about mindful communication. When someone learns how to listen to the other person, the chances of misunderstandings are greater reduced._x000D_
_x000D_
Transparent feedback should be encouraged as well, with little fear of reprimand or judgement from their thoughts and opinions. Feedback will help people know if they're on the same page, if they're experiencing problems, the areas they need to improve on or are lagging behind on, etc.

Name: Brian Munyinyi Kamau
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Creative Economy, Environment, Technology
Business Description: Gbambe Travel Agency (G.TA)will be a website that operates like E-commerce but in a tourism related way. It will offer Tours and Travel companies a platform to advertise their services at a small fee. Potential tourists will create accounts and log in to search for their preferred destinations with details from individual companies that posted the ad on how to go about in order to get the service advertised. The (G.T.A) website will act as an Escrow between the tourist and the tours and travel company whereby the tourist can even start saving money in their created account as early as a year before they decide on which trip to take from our website. Money will only be released on confirmation by the tourist that they have indeed verified that the trip is valid after which the company offering the trip will receive their payment from our website. The G.T.A website will cater for both local and International clients.  Once the website is fully developed and successful many more services will be added after thorough investigations.
Business Customers: Gbambe Travel Agency will cater for people who want to travel for both business and leisure by promoting tourism. It will also cater for travel companies who will use the website to source for customers.
Product Solution: Gbambe Travel Agency will solve the inadequacy of travel options by providing a wide range of tour destinations and also help by linking potential customers to travel companies. It will also help avoid fraud since money paid is only released after confirmation by the client.
Business Challenge: Gbambe Travel Agency G.T.A is an idea that requires web developers to implement and financing to cater for the developers fees and marketing which poses a major challenge to make it a reality but it is highly possible with financial backup.
Programme Benefit: Financial and Technical support will be of great help since the Gbambe Travel Agency idea is lucrative and will benefit many participants.
Programme Participation: By making frequent advertisements through newspapers, television and radio.

Name: Hellen Miano
Business Description:
YRec Juakali Academy is a startup youth skills and training academy that will be based in Murang'a with a vision of equipping youths with basic Artisan skills to empower them to self-employment with minimal capital and expertise or to employment within basic entry level . _x000D_
The Academy will provide skills and training to reduce poverty crisis and which our country grapples with daily. Moreover, since  poverty is exacerbated by unemployment and lack of basic skills to work in a workplace YRec Juakali Academy hopes to bridge this gap. _x000D_
Business Customers:
The Academy targets at-risk youths aged 18 to 25 especially from disadvantaged backgrounds, school dropouts and under-performing school graduates. _x000D_
_x000D_
Statistics from the Kenyan national census held in 2019 showed that 75% of the population were youths aged 18 to 35 years, further, Kenya Bureau of Statistics cites that 3 in 5 unemployed persons are youths which demonstrates the unemployment crisis in the country. _x000D_
_x000D_
Moreover, the cost of starting a business in Kenya is significantly high which daunts youths ambitions of starting businesses with the majority delaying their ambitions as they look for capital albeit without any skills to be employed. Vocational training costs on the other hand are still very expensive despite the government’s efforts in waiving the fees the at-risk youths especially from disadvantaged backgrounds are still unable to pursue or finish school._x000D_
_x000D_
 With this in mind YRec hopes to tap on these at- risk youths to empower them using a training module comprised of artisan skills training clustered into_x000D_
•	Technical: module : Fashion design, baking, and plant nursery_x000D_
•	Entrepreneurship module : business management , and  online businesses and  consultancy _x000D_
•	Applied skills module:  Life skills and Financial Literacy skills_x000D_
•	Job readiness module: Interview techniques, CV writing _x000D_
•	After school module: Mentorship and consultancy services._x000D_
_x000D_
The 8 weeks training will enable the entrepreneurial trainees start a basic business with a minimum capital requirements and skills since the Academy targets that the business they start will require 10$ only . The ones who want to be employed will be helped to secure an entry level job without the employers looking at the KCSE/KCPE grades._x000D_
Product Solution:
YRec Juakali Academy tackles the unemployment that many youths face and which makes them miss out in securing even the lowest entry level jobs  such as cleaning, front office, security etc._x000D_
_x000D_
The center seeks to also eradicate poverty posed by lack of means of livelihood among school drop outs, young parents and the youths who did not secure grades to pursue higher learning._x000D_
_x000D_
The challenge of bad attitude towards life which leads to many at-risk youths engaging in criminal activities while some others despair and accept poverty is another problem the center hopes tp tackle and combat appropriately._x000D_
_x000D_
Business Challenge: Lack of a premise from which the Center can operate from.
Programme Benefit: Financial support_x000D_
Programme Participation: Popularize its activities to reach many youths allover the country.
Programme Measures: Engagement of youths

Business Description: Buni is manufacturing startup working to scale African manufacturing. We're doing this by working with Juakali artisans and independent workshops to make consistent and well-engineered products. We're able to build products faster and more efficiently all without having to set up costly plants and factories.  We're currently building furniture as this allows us to build a product that the artisans have made before and lets us experiment with more complex processes and higher tolerances.
Business Customers: Our target market is anyone who purchases any custom made products or parts. This can be as diverse as a couch to car parts.

Programme Measures:
In any youth engagement effort, young people should be involved in design and decision-making from the beginning._x000D_
While empowerment is a critical component of any youth engagement effort, this does not translate to a sink-or-swim approach. It is important to provide young people with the support they need to succeed, which may include training, mentorship, facilitation, coordination, and protection. You must walk a fine line between empowerment and support: too much support stifles and too little can set young people up to fail.

Name: Philip Gachuki Mwangi
Business Description:
Our proposed business innovation aims at reducing cases of university students calling off semesters due to lack of school fees. Under SDG 4, we cannot achieve quality education with such distractions._x000D_
Our mobile application incorporates all universities. Students in a given university can share excess fees in their accounts to those with arrears. Also, a well wisher can donate to add to a university pool where a needy student can benefit._x000D_
We want to give students the right to use their excess amount in their school account to either help others, buy school items/materials such as in the school bookshop,  buying bundles, gym  or mess for meals._x000D_
Going further, we will go global to incorporate students across the world and donors from all over._x000D_
Assume every Kenyatta University donates KES 5 and we are 70 000 students that is KES.350 000 enough to keep several students in class. _x000D_
This is a work in progress and we have great plans coming. We are a team of 3._x000D_

Business Description:
Prints Africa creates custom photo books and custom prints. It will enable people to take their best photos and create photo books out of them. We help customers document and store their best memories in tangible memorable photo books - whether it is birthdays, picnic trips, vacations, graduations, achievements or just a consolidated group of photos the photo books the customer would like to remember. _x000D_
Prints Africa is in the early stages of the business. We have been creating samples to ensure the product is top quality and to test out different suppliers (printing and binding) to identify quality reliable ones in which we have successfully done. When the business has scale we will set up our own workshop and do everything inhouse for economies of scale._x000D_
We would like to start with the customer sharing the photos with us and we do the rest (design, print and deliver the photobook) but down the line we would like to develop an online platform that would enable the customer to create an account, upload photos, design their own photo book using layouts on the website, pay, submit and we do the printing ,binding and delivery. Customers who would like assistance with designing their photo books will only need to submit photos and we will do the design, submit to client for approval and payment, we print, bind and deliver the photo books._x000D_
 The business will not be limited to photo books only, as it grows other prints such as mugs, apparel, cards, home and gifts, stickers, and canvas prints among others will be available.
Business Customers:
The business will serve the general public - anyone who would like to document their memories using photo books and prints. Anyone with photos they have taken with their phone or camera can be a customer as log as they would like to create a photobook and other prints the business will offer. _x000D_
Due to purchasing power considerations, the target customers will be people in in the middle class category, upper middle class and above._x000D_
Product Solution:
Good phones with good camera quality are increasingly becoming cheaper. This allows people to take good quality photos everyday. A lot of memories have been stored using photos in digital format.  However, the photos in the phone are cluttered, can easily get deleted by mistake and can even get lost if phone is lost or spoilt and the images were not backed up. _x000D_
While the customer has many photos in their device, there are specific photos that mark specific events and experiences they would like to document. For example a child’s birthdays from their year one onwards._x000D_
To solve this problem, Prints Africa aims to help its customers to document these memories (the photos) forever by making physical memorable photobooks. A copy of the digital photobook is also backed up so that if the customer intends to print more copies much later they can._x000D_
Business Challenge:
My biggest challenge is building the technology platform (website) to power the business._x000D_
I would like to develop an online platform that would enable the customer to create an account, upload photos, design their own photo book using layouts on the website, make a submission and pay. For customers who would not like to design the photo books themselves, they will only need to submit the photos then our design assistants can design the photo book layout, share with customer for approval and payment on the website. We will prepare the photo book and deliver. The platform will not be limited to photo books only, other prints such as mugs, apparel, cards, home and gifts, stickers, and canvas prints will be available down the line after the photo book product is well developed on the platform and is fully functional._x000D_
Programme Benefit:
I would like to learn how to grow and scale a small business from scratch into something big, sustainable, profitable while keeping being customer focused, quality driven and innovative with new products and services._x000D_
I would also like support building the technology platform to power the business.
Programme Participation:
1. Increased awareness on entrepreneurship and civic engagement especially through social media - Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn._x000D_
2. More training in favour of entrepreneurship as opposed to employment at tertiary institutions._x000D_
3. Government incentives on youth owned businesses though legislation and increased business opportunities, less constraints for qualification in procurement for youth owned businesses._x000D_
Other Platforms: Social media - Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn
Programme Measures:
1. Training the youth in favour of entrepreneurship._x000D_
2. Digital literacy training in secondary schools and tertiary institutions._x000D_
3. Youth-led NGOs for entrepreneurship training and to support youth owned businesses with basic knowledge on business management and growth mentorship and reading materials.

Name: Daniel Mukora Machua
Business Description: MalPay is an online giving app that will ease the way worshipers give in their various churches. MalPay will be linked with all banks and mobile money services and therefore all believers can give to their churches through the app in just a few clicks.
Business Customers: Christianity is the main religion in Kenya. As of 2019, over 85 percent of the population identified as Christians, among which 33.4 percent were Protestants, 20.6 percent Catholics, 20.4 percent Evangelicals, and seven percent from African Instituted Churches. All these do pay their churches, give offering and pay other pledges in their various churches; both Christians and churches will be our targeted customers.
Product Solution: For many years , the collection of tithes and offering has been very standard. The tithes are collected in sealed envelopes and at the end of the church service, the church admin and assistants physically count the cash collected during the service. This method was rendered inefficient and absolute especially during the Covid19 pandemic that led to churches being closed and members being disconnected from their current method of paying offering and tithes hence creating a need for a convenient digital platform.
Business Challenge: The biggest challenge I'm facing right now is the huge amount of capital to pay the best developers who will develop the app to the very desired standards.
Programme Benefit: If selected I would love to ask for capital to be able to pay the right developers who will help in the production of my product.
Programme Participation: National Youth Council can increase youth participation by encouraging the already involved youth to encourage their peers. Mostly you will realize most youth do not hear and know of any Youth initiatives happening around.
Programme Measures: Proper advertisement should be done to ensure that all youth are actually aware of any Youth initiatives happening around their counties or even the entire country.

Name: Caren Wafula

We provide outpatient and home care services._x000D_
_x000D_
I have a keen interest in maternal and child health.I have developed a program dubbed 'Tembea na Dada' which aims at improving prenatal,maternal health and birth outcomes._x000D_
_x000D_

procuring arbortion.The program gave them a friendly approach to their 'crisis' management.

The fear and anxiety that comes with expecting for the first time._x000D_

Name: Pharis Wambugu Jane
Business Description: We are working with youth groups in Kiambu County in setting up multistorey vertical gardens. These multistorey vertical gardens are installed in small space. We have planted vegetables ,medicinal herbs and fruits that require small spaces like strawberries. the equivalent of one well installed multistorey vertical garden is a quarter piece of land. We then sell the vegetables as a source of income for the youths and make a saving.
Business Customers: The business will serve mainly the people around the project site as well as supply the surplus fruits and vegetables into the market. We are planning to start packaging the vegetables for home deliveries especially for people who value eating healthy and clean veggies.
Product Solution:
The main problem that we aim to solve is youth unemployment. since we work with youth groups. Its easier for youths in a group to come together and start such a project. We then partner with them in marketing the produce._x000D_
we also aim to enhance healthy diet since the vegetables mainly sold around Nairobi are said to be grown along the sewer lines. We aim to restore the trust by ensuring our vegetables are grown in a hygienic environment and delivered at the the customers' doorstep.
Business Challenge: The biggest challenge is financing of these projects. We have already set up 3 gardens in Riabai with Riabai Youth and 2 with Githurai Youth Bunge. This has drained our finances but the results can be seen in how well the gardens are coming up.
Programme Benefit: We would like financial and technical support. Currently the spaces that we have, are given to us by the community like in Riabai; the space is given to us by Riabai Police post. If we could get a larger space we could set up more gardens and also use it as a resource centre for other interested youth groups to come and learn.
Programme Participation:
I highly recommend that you work with youth groups since engaging individual youths is hectic and some might not be interested. This will create interest in the other youths to join your programs._x000D_
You can equally develop a pyramid type of networking where you have youth officers even at ward level to help in mapping out their areas as well as keeping the council posted on happenings on the ground.
Engamenet Ways: Voluntary work, Internships and work placements, Training
Programs Interested: Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement, Creative Economy, Agriculture
Programme Measures: Conduct civic education on what NYC entails. Most of the youths in mashinani do not know that NYC exists and those who do: dont know how to access the services of NYC. Civic education would be the first step towards the light.

Name: Joel kipkorir
Business Description:
Vooli is a seamless and accessible on demand insurance platform that caters to the uninsured and underinsured across Africa through its web and App._x000D_
Vooli utilizes APIs from a multiple insurance companies to develop an array insurance quotes( from cheap to expensive) according to the data points we have collected from the client. This comparative pricing significantly lowers the cost of insurance since one can aggregate his/her risk with one company or select different companies for different risks._x000D_
The platform eliminates totally the current touchpoint model used by insurance, this consequently removes fraud through collusion and enhances the smoothness of service delivery._x000D_
_x000D_
This consequently enables deeper understanding of the clients needs and improves customer centricity from the insurance company and all other  players in the value chain promoting price sensitivity and thereby inclusivity._x000D_
Business Customers:
General insurance clients._x000D_
In 2021,there are 490 million people in Africa living in extreme poverty(ie earn less than $1.9 dollars per day), or 36% of the total population. This number is up from 481 million in 2019. As a whole, Africa is not on target to meet it’s Sustainable Development Goal 1 – Eradicate Poverty by 2030._x000D_
_x000D_
This is because access to basic financial services is wanting, their needs includes firstly, education about insurance, secondly cheaper and tailor made services rather than the blanket covers that exist and most importantly a reliable and interactive platform for delivery of policies, customer service and payout incase of claims._x000D_
In Africa, MSMEs are estimated to contribute 70 percent of the region’s total employment. However,99.9 % of these have even the basic business insurance._x000D_
_x000D_
Consequently, when a peril occurs eg fire, then the blunt of the loss is passed to the proprietor leading to personal losses and consequently poverty._x000D_
_x000D_
Vooli insurtech comes in to resolve this issue, by offering targeted insurance in all classes, we eliminate the problem of blanket cover insurance cover making insurance cheap hence inclusive._x000D_
_x000D_
All these services are delivered in a personalized app and web platform in a low pressure, interactive and professional manner
Product Solution:
Low insurance penetration - Africa's insurance penetration has stagnated at 2.8% average, over 97 % of the population is uninsured._x000D_
_x000D_
Fraud- The insurance sector in Kenya has recorded KES3.27bn ($30.05m) in underwriting losses, its worst in over two decades majorly due to fraudulent claims._x000D_
_x000D_
Access to insurance and Inclusion- The insurance process is long, slow and winded and relies solely on salespeople leading to frustrations for the insureds._x000D_
The insurance delivery method is also completely broken, one can only insurance from brokers, agents or directly from the insurance company(which are mainly un the cities)_x000D_
_x000D_
● Buying from agents/brokers leaves you from the_x000D_
insurance company you have bought a policy from._x000D_
● Sometimes clients genuinely forget that their insurance cover_x000D_
has lapsed which ends up costing them a lot of money in fines._x000D_
● The process takes long for customers to complete due to_x000D_
the number of forms one needs to fill._x000D_
_x000D_
Finally, the systems used have no fraud detection mechanisms, this leaves the few who are insured at the mercy of fraudsters who masquerade as companies,$30 M in loss was reported in 2019 in Kenya, the worst over two decades._x000D_
_x000D_
The agency relies solely Technology to meet all it's registration, servicing, claim settlement procedures to reduce human error and eliminate fraud. Vooli takes this to the next level by fully blending_x000D_
insurance and API technology to automate the valuation and claim process completely and make it as seamless as possible. _x000D_
_x000D_
Our ambition is to use 0% paper in the entire process and with the support of our insurance carriers meet our clients’ needs fully._x000D_
Born of data driven customer science,Vooli comes in to fulfil core areas in customer centricity providing a_x000D_
framework for action through giving the clients access to policy data and companies an insight to track, measure_x000D_
and fulfil their part in customer-centric activation to drive customer loyalty._x000D_
Vooli uses valuation API technology to valuate premiums for the carriers (insurance companies).Insurance premiums vary due to insured declared values(IDV),specific client needs and risk profiles, we use that information to create the most cost effective insurance cover there is no one size fit all.
Business Challenge:
Technology Gaps._x000D_
Hesitating over API utilization-In big companies, sometimes management can neglect to track APIs and their utilization numbers. From this point, you can incur many charges and leave yourself open to security risks due to exposed APIs. _x000D_
_x000D_
Covid-19._x000D_
Currently we are in our blitz go to market but Covid has re shaped the landscape in terms of how people prioritize consumption, this has been exceptionally hard on the insurance industry._x000D_
_x000D_
Financial challenges._x000D_
Raising Venture capital is hard in Africa due to lack of sufficient networks and VCs operating in Africa_x000D_
Specify 36: Catapult inclusion Africa by Luxembourg House of Financial Technology
Programme Benefit:
Financial Support._x000D_
Mentorship and capacity building support_x000D_
Networking support.
Reffered By: LinkedIn post, From National Youth Council
Programme Participation: More social media engagement through relevant programs that encourage networking
Programme Measures: Increased co-ordination through social media.

Name: Okanda Eugine Stephen
Business Description:
EmpoweredMinds Hub is a Consultancy Firm that deals with Human Skills Development._x000D_
_x000D_
You are a Resource, a Brand and a Cutting edge tool that carries unimaginable potential that can give your career growth, organizations and institution an upward mobility and authentic synergy._x000D_
We don’t measure success by what we have done, rather, by comparing wat we have done vis-à-vis what we ought to have done. This is called understanding the standard of operation. Working from the end. _x000D_
To make this realistic and achievable, you may need an honest inner look, an inspiration, a push of some sought and a high impact tool of training to tap into this unrealized potential. _x000D_
Because we care for your personal growth and development, EmpoweredMinds Hub helps you and your team reshape your thinking, connect with the inner leader and explore the inner potential. _x000D_
We will help you and your team see that you are valuable resource and a brand. We will help you identify and close performance gaps and increase the output of your success and excellence._x000D_
In my experiential journey and learning, I have realize there are fewer institution that really help the human resource achieve its objective and purpose. As a result many have fallen trap of doing a job and career they don’t like hence reducing organizational effectiveness and efficiency. In many instances, most of the corporate leaders miss on the nitty-gritties of principle of leadership and people management skills. As a result, the team leader is totally disconnected with the team. Better still, many organization are not enjoying or experiencing the required inner potential of its employees._x000D_
On the individual basis, many professionals have failed to really understand what on earth are supposed to do, the question of purpose and vision. Many have ended up doing errands they don’t like just to survive. On the other hand, many have buried and given up on their inner potential and capabilities as a human resource._x000D_
How then do you achieve personal growth and development? EmpoweredMinds Hub is here to help you craft your brand by tapping into your inner capabilities._x000D_

Business Description:

Among the services we offer are brooding of chicks, hatching of eggs, and training to farmers._x000D_
More importantly, the business appreciates the use of technology and through it, we are able to do marketing through our social media pages and conduct various research activities over the internet. _x000D_
Being a professional Engineer, I have been able to integrate some automation activities such as brooding and hatching in the farm that helps in improving efficiency. _x000D_

Our business serves other businesses and individuals in need of content for their social media or public signage._x000D_
For instance, if a business wants to launch a new range of products, it will be more cost effective if they advertise on social media than if they rely on word of mouth or pay top billings to run a commercial in traditional media. With facebook or Google ads, we can target the potential buyers much more accurately and therefore the clients will have better returns for their investment.
Product Solution: Digital strategy and content increases visibility of our clients' brand and products, so that if their goal is to increase sales at their shops, it's an affordable route to take. Programme Benefit: Paid work.
