Name: Derrick Ngigi
Business Description:
Small and medium-scale farmers lack a cheap and comprehensive farm data collection method and infrastructure leading to deficiency in crucial data to drive precision farming in Kenya._x000D_
ShambaAssistant is a cheap and comprehensive data collection tool that allows (small and medium-scale) farmers in Kenya to collect data from their farms easily. The data include Soil Moisture, Soil PH, Soil Nitrogen, Potassium and Phosphorus Content, Air Humidity, Air Temperature, and Crop images._x000D_
The data is automatically uploaded on the cloud, where images are analyzed with an Artificial Intelligence model to determine crop health hence predict expected yields and the presence of symptoms of crop pests and crop diseases. Moreover, soil data is mapped to our geographical information mapping system. From the data analysis, feedback to guide farmers is relayed through USSD, SMS, and Calls to advise on the suitable fertilizer input and recommended pesticide to use._x000D_
Business Customers: Our target customers are small and medium-scale farmers in Kenya, without internet access or smartphones. This category consists of up to 70% of small and medium-scale farms. Interestingly 98% of the population have access to feature phones. While existing solutions on-farm data collection and analysis require access to the internet and the use of smartphones to upload data and give feedback through the web or mobile apps, we target to utilize USSD and SMS service only.
Product Solution:
The specific problem we seek to address is the lack of a structured and affordable data collection method and infrastructure that allows for integration with 4th industrial technologies such as the internet of things, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and remote sensing, therefore, impeding assimilation of precision farming among small and medium-scale farmers in Kenya._x000D_
Precision farming is data-driven agriculture, it helps reduce the cost of production and maximizes farm yields. It is the future of successful agriculture. By frequently analyzing data from the farm, farmers are able to know what to plant, when to plant, what fertilizer to use, and when and where to use the fertilizers. Unfortunately, the technology involved in the data collection; drones, and satellites are too expensive and inaccessible in developing countries. Additionally, agricultural extension services are not available to support frequent testing of the soil. Without effective and cheap data, the collection method of precision farming is limited.
Business Challenge: Lack of industrial linkages: It is a major challenge to look for an industrial and market connection to help you venture into the market. While we are still a young startup, it’s difficult to reach the market without a larger partner who will help build confidence with the customers and clients. This was very evident before partnering with the Program for Capacity Development Africa (P4CDA); farmers were very reluctant to allow us to test the product on their farms.
Programme Benefit:
Mentorship_x000D_
Industrial Linkages
Programme Participation:
1. Wide advertisement for opportunities especially on social media platforms._x000D_
2. Fair and Just selection system._x000D_
3. Listening to their opinions.
Programme Measures:
1. Inclusive decision-making process - it would allow the youth to own the process and engage better._x000D_
2. Keeping the focus on the project and benefits that would help the youth rather than political gains.

Once I get one,I have a team of 10 to 15 youths whom I closely work with as painters.I pay them on contractual basis._x000D_
In circumstances where we are to paint gloss paints(for metals;that is doors and windows,we procure the gloss paints from local hardwares.However we have a goal to introduce production of gloss Paints plus other products once we get financially stable.
Business Customers: Our target group is any customer who needs paint works,whether for repainting or those who need first time painting works.
Product Solution:
_x000D_
We are solving our customers problems in terms of paint works because we are providing our product as a package; quality paints plus experienced painters._x000D_
_x000D_
We are providing quality paints at favourable prices compared to the prices from hardwares._x000D_
Our product is also flexible in terms of the shades would require considering where they need it painted because we are able to provide any shade that our customers would request for._x000D_
We also offer professional advice to our customers and guide them on which piant product is suitable for specific places.We also guide them on colour matching to their satisfaction._x000D_
_x000D_

Our biggest challenges are finances to get our product certified by the KEBS so we can get the KEBS certificate.This will enable us to brand our product hence we can sell at whosesale prices to lacally hardwares._x000D_
Were it not for financial constraints,we intend to increase our current production and also introduce other products (gloss paints, terpentine,vurnishes.)_x000D_
We also would wish to invest more on better machines._x000D_

Name: KEVIN BOB NDICHU KIMANI
Business Description:
NAKULINK ONLINE SHOPPING is an e-commerce platform which is a software application that allows businesses to sell their products and customers to buy the products online and they are delivered to the desired place_x000D_
Its basically just buying and selling over the internet in lay man’s language._x000D_
Nakulink has web shops which are integrated to the main site. A seller logs onto the system and customize their web shop, add their products and you are ready to sell to millions of users_x000D_
This platform has a countrywide reach, in all areas that have access to internet. This ensures your business has a wider reach._x000D_
Cumulatively since we launched the platform, we have over 100,000 site visits in less than 3 months and we are targeting 10 million visits before the end of 2021_x000D_
NAKULINK ONLINE SHOPPING handles all the delivery logistics for the vendors and ensure timely delivery to their respective clients and ensure we offer good customer service and after sale services. For payments on delivery, we collect the cash on behalf of the vendor and ensure the money gets to them_x000D_
_x000D_
Business Customers:
The main reason for developing this online platform was to empower SMEs in our society and ensure that we increase the sales of the small businesses as we give them an opportunity for them to sell their goods countrywide without worrying about the delivery logistics_x000D_
We noticed that operating only a physical shop limits our growth in different ways. Someone has to physically come to your shop and most likely that person is from within that locality. Whereas online shopping gives you an opportunity to reach anyone within the Kenyan borders and even the rest of Africa in future. Its growth is unimaginable._x000D_
We came up with the idea of an online shopping platform not only for us but for all entrepreneurs out there._x000D_
This platform also addresses the fact that we live in an era where people prefer having their items delivered to the comfort of their homes which saves one time and the hustle to go to the shopping centers to look for items, especially for items which you are not very familiar with._x000D_
This is also in line with the MOH guidelines on observing the COVID-19 protocols
Product Solution:
The online shopping platform is here to addresses the fact that we live in an era where people prefer having their items delivered to the comfort of their homes which saves one time and the hustle to go to the shopping centers to look for items, especially for items which you are not very familiar with._x000D_
This is also in line with the MOH guidelines on observing the COVID-19 protocols. You just order an item from your preferred store which is listed on the Nakulink Online Shopping and have your items delivered to your home
Business Challenge:
Like all businesses we also encounter challenges : _x000D_
1.)We need more working capital – To ensure the smooth running of delivery activities as the business expands, we’ll require a bit of more capital to build infrastructure and increase the work force and the effective marketing campaigns_x000D_
2.)Cyber and Data Security -its not really a problem that has affected us so far but it’s a concern and you have to take the necessary measures to ensure that you are well protected and also aware and have counter actions.it something that is real _x000D_
3.) FRAUDSTERS/CREDIBILITY - The online market has had many cases of fraud and conmen and this has made it very hard for people to trust online sellers this has impacted us negatively and it becomes a bit of a challenge to be credible and to be trusted by the clients_x000D_
4.) ACCCESS TO CREDIT FACILITIES - We have a bit of challenge to access credit since we do not have security / logbooks which act as security for the loans_x000D_
Programme Benefit:
1.)if we can get someone who facilitation to access credit /loans - We have a bit of challenge to access credit since we do not have security / logbooks which act as security for the loans_x000D_
_x000D_
2.) we also would appreciate mentors/ professionals who are more experienced in this sector who can offer mentorship and training to our staff to help us improve the services we offer to our clients and also assist in the day to day running of the company_x000D_
_x000D_
3.)We need more working capital – To ensure the smooth running of delivery activities as the business expands, we’ll require a bit of more capital to build infrastructure and increase the work force and the effective marketing campaigns. if we can get investors to partner with or venture capitalists to partner with us_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

_x000D_

Name: Wilfred Chege
Business Description:
We Kenya's first student friendly online mall. We have tailored our platform to provide students and young people an e-commerce solution to their everyday needs. We avail to students an online textbook store, uniform store, supermarket and PSV ticketing system. To young people in and recently out of tertiary institutions, we avail relevant vendor stores such as  affordable food and apparels vendors. Our platform is both in Android and IOS._x000D_
Once our customers downloads our mobile application on Android or IOS, He/ She access our listed vendors and adds their goods/services to cart, specifies their drop-off location and pays . Once payment has been verified, We undertake to organize for delivery to the specified drop-off location.
Business Customers: Our main focus is on students and young people in and recently out of tertiary institutions. This is an ag bracket of 7-27 years old.
Product Solution: Nearly 10,000 students flock less than 5 retail stores In Nakuru town during back to school periods. Their counter-parts in and recently out of tertiary institutions struggle to find quality and affordable goods and services. We  address these needs by providing students with an online textbook store, uniform store, supermarket and PSV ticketing system. To young people in and recently out of tertiary institutions, we avail relevant vendor stores such as  affordable food and apparels vendors. Our platform is both in Android and IOS.
Business Challenge: The covid-19 pandemic has really affected our business since we heavily really on students being in school. When the government puts a hold on all physical learning we are at a loss.
Specify 36: The Anzisha prize fellowship cohort of 2020
Programme Benefit: I would like if We could be formally introduced to school administrations both in high school and tertiary institutions so that we can have a direct audience to students to better market and tailor our solutions. We also have a project that we would love to implement, which involves installing tablets in schools to facilitate students to order even when in school and pay via their e-wallets. We need financial  or material (tablets)aid so as to achieve this.
Programme Participation: Increase its Social media presence and campaigns as a majority of the youth are on social media.
Programme Measures: We should have a structure whereby we have reps in all learning institutions who report to a county rep and consequently a national rep. I believe this will aid in coordinating youth  initiatives,

Name: Daniel Lepesh
Business Description:
Loadmoran has been designed to organize the unorganized logistics industry. Our logistics solutions include freight, storage/warehousing and fulfillment._x000D_
FREIGHT:Our freight solutions focuses on getting items from point A to point B as quickly and efficiently as possible. We realized the level of disorganization and the inefficiency in the logistics sector, and decided to do something about it. The platform provides a forum for the negotiation of prices between a cargo owner and the transporter. It brings in the aspect of competitive freight bidding, which means that the transporter that bids the lowest price gets to move the goods._x000D_
STORAGE/WAREHOUSING: Incase the cargo owner requires storage space, we provide the same with space rentals starting from as little as a pallet, or 2 metres squared to as much as a whole warehouse and a minimum storage period of 5 days. We also have a storage-by-bin model for e-commerce vendors. When a vendor has excess stock, we supply the storage bins, they pack the stock and we store until they need it back._x000D_
FULFILLMENT: A solution for e-commerce stores and distributors, where we help them pick-pack-deliver their goods. We use our freight and warehousing infrastructure to handle the entire process._x000D_
Logistics+Tech is definitely a winner. For a very long period of time, logistics activities have traditionally been conducted using the traditional paper/person model. Loadmoran wants to change this by introducing technology into the whole chain of logistics. _x000D_
_x000D_
REVENUE MODEL:_x000D_
- Upon successful negotiation between the customer and transporter, the customer pays a 70% deposit upfront and we pay the transporter a 50% advance payment._x000D_
- Upon Load delivery, the customer pays the remaining balance._x000D_
- We then charge the transporter a 10-15% commission for that load._x000D_
- For Instance, moving a 20FT container from Mombasa to Kampala currently costs about 2,400 USD (~ Ksh 244,000), charging a 10% commission= Ksh. 24,400. If we move one load a day on that particular route alone, this translates to ~ Ksh. 732,000 per month._x000D_
- Storage: we charge a flat rate per day depending on storage size required. We also have storage by-bin model. Each bin is charged a flat rate per day, depending on bin size._x000D_
_x000D_
Logistics+Tech is definitely a winner. For a very long period of time, logistics activities have traditionally been conducted using the traditional paper/person model. Loadmoran wants to change this by introducing technology into the whole chain of logistics. This will in turn bring in efficiency and help to considerably lower the cost of goods in the country and continent at large. Kenya has a 91% penetration of mobile subscriptions with Internet access through the mobile phone in the country recently hitting an all time high of 83%. This implies that our service can be accessed almost anywhere in the country.
Business Customers:
Target Market & Opportunity:_x000D_
- Small Transporters and individual operators._x000D_
- Large Transporters with sizable truck fleet_x000D_
- Shippers/Cargo owners._x000D_
- Freight forwarders and Cargo Clearing companies._x000D_
- E-commerce stores._x000D_
- Warehouse owners._x000D_
Product Solution:
In Africa, upto 75% of a product’s cost is due to logistics as compared to 6% in the USA. Loadmoran wants to implement a responsive transportation solution which will allow a more effective and economical transportation network that will lower the cost of goods. The system is designed to tackle a 180 Billion Dollar logistics problem in Africa by bringing together key players in the logistics chain (Cargo owner, transporter and warehousing)._x000D_
According to research done by the Kenya Transporters Association, on average, Kenyan trucks are presently doing 60,000 - 96,000 KMs/truck/year thus driving transport costs to an estimated 30% of the value of traded goods. In the most efficient trade corridors, the average KMs/truck/year is between 120,000 to 150,000, translating into significantly affordable transport and logistics costs of up to an average 4% of the value of traded goods.
Business Challenge:
The biggest challenge we are currently facing is lack of sufficient funds for expansion of business activities. We believe that we've put enough measures and processes in place for the next phase which is growth._x000D_
The fund will will help us scale business activities such as onboarding more customers and partners (bike/van/pickup/truck owners). Our aim is to have as many vehicles registered on our platform as possible. This is only possible through intensive marketing, offering incentives such as fuel financing for the transporter, vehicle financing and timely payment. Another aspect that the fund would help us grow is establishment of fulfillment centres and the warehousing infrastructure._x000D_
Employees are a critical aspect of any venture. Getting the right talent is key to us and securing the fund would go a long way in helping us grow our talent pool in the company._x000D_
The fund would also help us grow our technology. In all our products, technology is key as it brings efficiency and lowers the cost of doing business. Therefore, growing our technology offering, scaling system functionalities and streamlining all our online processes is key.
Programme Benefit: Loadmoran is a freight matching platform designed to tackle a 180 Billion Dollar logistics problem in Africa by bringing together key players in the logistics chain of business, i.e. Cargo owners, transporters, Warehouses all under one platform through technology. We want to implement a responsive transportation and fulfillment solution which will allow a more effective and economical transportation network, while at the same time creating job opportunities for the young people in the region. We are currently looking for funding opportunities to help us scale business activities such as onboarding more partners, establishing fulfillment centres and technology upgrade. One of the goals of setting up the company was to create job opportunities for the young person. We believe the program can help us achieve this through funding, mentoring/coaching, networking and linking us to potential markets.
Reffered By: Facebook post, Press/Media Mention (newspaper, radio or TV) or Blog Article
Programme Participation: Involving as many youth as possible on all matters of the council. Instead of training youth to be employees, come up with programs that try to create employers out of the youth through funding initiatives and accelerator programs. The council should also be on the forefront to drive funding and link youth startups to potential investors.
Programme Measures: By devolving the council's leadership all the way to the village level.

The indeginous tree business is a project where we, a group of youths plant and sell indeginous trees to customers._x000D_
The whole process is a step by step process done in a specific manner. _x000D_
We plant seeds in a nursery and after they grow into seedlings we transfer them into tree planting bags and put them in a nursery for them to mature well before we sell them._x000D_
Prices of the trees vary for different types of trees._x000D_
_x000D_
For the grafted avocado trees, we look for the seeds from different homesteads as well as foots of avocado trees._x000D_
We then plant them in bags and when they are  grown into seedlings we graft them together._x000D_
We cover the seedlings for them to make buds and grow before selling them to customers.

It would serve the entire public._x000D_
It will also serve county/country agricultural/environmental sector which needs the trees or avocado trees for export which in turn will create income and thus boost the economy.

_x000D_
The indeginous trees will help conserve water catchment areas._x000D_
_x000D_
The indeginous trees will also help in conserving our indeginous forests.

1.Ready Market._x000D_
2.Lack of funds to by equipment e.g planting bags.

Name: RONALD YEGON
Business Description: Our business markets the environmental products from locals through the website. With this in mind, it will enable the youths to concentrate on primary production and by so doing there will have been created relatively many jobs. This will solve the unemployment while conserving environment, which is our major objective.
Business Customers: The business shall majorly serve the youths by providing job opportunities and also the general public by championing a better environment.
Product Solution:
This product will solve the following to the customers_x000D_
_x000D_
-Convenience. _x000D_
Convenience is the biggest perk. Where else can you comfortably buy trees at midnight while in your pajamas? There are no lines to wait in nursery sites or nursery attendants to wait on to help you with your purchases, and you can do your shopping in minutes. Our online tree shop gives us the opportunity to shop 24/7 and also rewards us with a ‘no pollution’ shopping experience. _x000D_
_x000D_
-You can buy trees in diaspora and have them delivered in your preferred. _x000D_
Sending trees to a place of your choice and friends is easy, no matter where they are. Now, there is no need to make distance an excuse for not planting trees, or contributing to environmental actions._x000D_
_x000D_
-No need to travel. _x000D_
People don't usually like to move a lot to get what they want. Of course, nothing can compete with the experience of going to a tree nursery and buying the trees you want, but normally people just don't want to travel. Customers don't usually leave near the tree nurseries they would want to visit, but today they have an option to visit our shop online. _x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
-Bringing together Common Interest People. _x000D_
There are several tree nurseries all over the country. Sometimes you don't get all the species of trees in one tree nursery, but you can get them from the other tree nurseries. SYECO is bringing on board all the tree nurseries by proving a market for their stock._x000D_
Business Challenge: The biggest challenge facing this product is insufficient finance to start it off. One other challenge is that people have never about online tree purchasing, so we will have to spend a lot on marketing, and issue that will finally revolve around the financial position of the organisation
Programme Benefit: Financial support and start up guidance
Programme Participation: Increase representation at the grassroot level
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Environment, Technology, Agriculture
Programme Measures: Youth involvement should be increased in the county level

Business Description: My business is about recycling solid waste into useful products. Recycling broken glass into art and building materials, empty plastic and glass bottles into art. All biodegradable waste can be converted into compost manure for sale at lower prices to farmers within the county. Converting green waste into vemiculture. Waste tomatoes from the market and homesteads can make paint to be sold at a cheaper price to the residents. Waste paper, leaves, sticks, charcoal remains can be converted into charcoal briquettes. This will help protects our forest covers and also provide sustainable fuel for the residents. Styrofoam can also be used to make indoor water falls. In the same space where recycling is happening, a park that depicts waste recycling is to be established. Within the park there is an outdoor restaurant and cocktails bar is set up. Basically this will use up all waste within the country and convert it into useful products for sale.
Business Customers: Residents of Kakamega County, international tourists and local tourists who Wil want to learn about recycling and also see and buy the beauty of recycled art, products like art can be exported.
Product Solution: Gas is too expensive at the moment the charcoal briquettes will provide cheaper and sustainable fuel. It will also provide jobs to upto 500 workers within a three year period. Therefore some people that have been retrenched due to Corona Virus will have jobs. It will also teach people to be conscious about their environment. Will also provide cheaper and more effective manure for farmers and therefore more produce. This will lure people back to Agriculture.
Business Challenge: I do not have capital. I need a piece of land where all these can take place.

Name: ANOLD NYONGESA
Business Description:
This business will be under self-proprietorship or individually established. The proprietor of the business is ANOLD NYONGESA 23 years old. Through the teachings from the experienced  poultry famers and consultations from my fellow youths, I was able to gain some knowledge and skills. This enhanced me to get more research on poultry farm business idea and I was also able to come up with a  good identity of this business plan as my choice. On the capital estimation for the business will be at 100,000 shillings on the start of operation. That money will be contributed through personal savings, loans and relative contributions. The business plan proposed was all about Poultry farm or keeping as business. The poultry farm involves the production of broilers meat and layer’s eggs also keeping of chicks when young. The poultry farm business its lucrative and wide industry that has attracted millions of investors over the years.This poultry business will also involve keeping of ducks, turkeys, doves e.t.c. This will boost the business as some of the customers may want other consumption of poultry birds which are different from chicken. The poultry keeping business is widely practiced as some people keep or rear them in their homesteads for food consumption while others rear or keep them for income._x000D_
Tuomoke Pamoja Poultry Farm is a business that will involve buying and selling of poultry products e.g. Eggs Broilers meat Sale of other poultry birds such as duck, goose, doves Sale of poultry vaccines, feeds and supplement _x000D_
 My main reasons as to why I decided to take on sole proprietorship as a form of business ownership is because:-_x000D_
a)I want to be accountable to myself in case of profit or loss incurred in the process of business operation or management._x000D_
b)I want to create customer and personal contact to have their interests at hand which will bring good relation on provision of services._x000D_
c)I will be accountable on making personal choice on how to run my business in my own way, make faster decisions and implement my own decision. _x000D_
The proposed business will be located in Near Kakamega Main prison. This location in Lurambi area for the business will be successful as it is near to Kakamega town centre.The area is well developed as there is easier way to acquire electricity, cheap labour, raw materials or food for the poultry, security, quick and easiest means of transport and communication. The business can be located in my home. Customers can reach there by notifying the posters attached on the entrance. The residents in Kakamega town are Abaluhya Community mainly who rely majorly on farming as some practice dairy farming and others keeping of poultry which may lead to contribution of customers to the business._x000D_
 GOALS;_x000D_
 As the owner of the business, my main goals achievement is to create conducive agronomic and economical environment to the community, my county and to the nation at large by providing quality services from the poultry farm business. My great expectation is expired the business to make it known to other counties and receive more orders from hotels and supermarket._x000D_
 VISION_x000D_
The vision of Tuomoke Pamoja Poultry Farm is to ensure the productivity of good and nutrients eggs with also good quality of broilers meat.Also by having customers’ wants customers ‘want being satisfied through good services delivery. _x000D_
PRODUCTS AND SERVICES _x000D_
The products mainly from Tuomoke Pamoja poultry farm are eggs, broilers meat, manure, marketing and distribution of table eggs. There is also availability of vaccines, drugs and supplements on sale. Production of poultry farm equipment like drinkers, feeders.Services to the customers' will be done direct contact sale or through use of transport means such as motorcycles. This will enable quick distribution of the products to the customers hence safe delivery._x000D_
Kakamega town area is densely populated and when we total the approximate number of people or the population it can 2.5 million people.Tuomoke Pamoja Poultry farm expects to give services 50,000 people during its period of operation. _x000D_
Business Customers: Tuomoke Pamoja Poultry Farm business mainly its customers are locals, hotels, baking industries and shops or supermarkets.Through quick and safety on delivery of services from the poultry business, the business will develop and expand marginally.This led to receiving tenders for supplying eggs and broilers to different major hotels in the town. Also most of the customers are the local people who search for broilers meat for events like weddings, graduation parties chamas e.t.c  with eggs included.The poultry business is profitable as much income is received and also it undergoes loses in its operation but there are strategies to boost it’s growth and development.As the manager of this poultry business, I have conducted and intervene market survey and analyzed the market scope, buying system and various ways in which the business will increase competition and improve the market.Satisfied customers are my best exhibitors as when they get good and quality services I offer they will be able to inform others.On the progression of this poultry business most of the customers or clients will be from schools, hotels, shops, supermarkets and a ready market. There will be free delivery and telephone order services depending on the services or wants needed or provided.
Product Solution:
Poor customers services_x000D_
Poor exhibition_x000D_
Inadequate resource_x000D_
Inadequate stock_x000D_
High pricing
Business Challenge: Source of capital for my poultry farm business idea.
Programme Benefit:
I would love to get support for my ideas for income activities._x000D_
Support my idea of Tuomoke Pamoja Poultry Farm.

Name: Gilead Mukavale
Business Description:
The On-Road Vehicle Mechanics Finder is presented in form of both a mobile application and a responsive website that is user interactive. Both provides access to almost all the services that drivers might need while driving on our public roads. The idea behind the development of this project is to provide instant support to drivers in case their vehicles break down on the highway thus reducing unnecessary traffic build-up._x000D_
The application is also meant to enable drivers locate mechanics within the area, available garages and fuel stations and all the car towing service providers. Furthermore, both the app and the web components will enable drivers to find available spare parts and accessories’ dealer shops, view the available parts and link-up foe purchase in case he/she needs the spare parts for the vehicle._x000D_
Business Customers: The main customer of this product will be drivers. The situation right now on our public roads requires instant support because our roads are ever busy and one single breakdown can affect the whole transport system within that particular route. The app and website will provide crucial services such as car towing, garages and displaying available mechanics within the area of breakdown to release traffic within minutes. This will be made possible through the use of google API's that display the exact service stations on the driver's terminal.
Product Solution:
1. The ON-ROAD VEHICLE MECHANICS FINDER will help drivers locate mechanics and call for assistance when their cars break down based on their current location._x000D_
2.  Many towing companies delay in delivering services when a car breaks down in the middle of a highway. The On-Road Vehicle Mechanics Finder has an embedded assistance that allows drivers to communicate with the towing station manager in real time and look for means to release traffic as fast as possible._x000D_
3.  Drivers will now need to have no worries about running out of fuel when travelling because the application will be able to display all the available fuel stations within the area._x000D_
4. The system provides and Integrated spare parts and accessories dealers with an enabled car model, brand and specific parts searching assistance._x000D_
5. The system displays all the on-road garages and towing stations available
Business Challenge: Currently, I have not encountered any problems as my system is yet to be launched in the real market scenario. I did this project as part of my 4th year project in partial fulfillment of my Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. The project is still undergoing some few upgrades in terms of functionalities and user interface.
Programme Benefit: I would like to be supported financially in implementing and marketing this product countrywide and registering all available mechanics along our Kenyan Highways in an aim of reducing traffic when cars break down.
Programme Participation: I recommend the National Youth Council to roll out this program in every county through the use of village elders who are the most reliable sources of information to youths even in remote areas.
Programme Measures:
1. Elect a centralized body in each county to be responsible for disseminating information published by the National Youth Council._x000D_
2. Elect transparent and trustworthy leaders for efficient coordination._x000D_
3. Elect youths to be part of the initiative.

Name: Collins Ojiwa
Which School: Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology
Business Description: VoR Sports is a start-up business that deals in sports as a health therapy.  As a health-based start-up, the business deals with encouraging individuals to take up exercise and sports as a therapy to various lifestyle diseases such as obesity, depression and fatigue. _x000D_
Business Customers:
This business serves people especially in employment who by nature of their working environment, they spend many hours so many hours either on computers or doing very strenuous activities. In return, these activities compromise their wellbeing as the body becomes more inactive. _x000D_
With inactive bodies, it becomes hard for them to be productive as expected by their various employers. This program, therefore, helps in having such individuals engage in exercises from low impact to high impact levels. The level at which an individual participates depended on factors such as availability of the clients during the sessions, age and fitness levels.
Product Solution: This business aims towards increasing the viability of employees and employers by engaging them in physical activities which many workplaces don't offer. By doing this, it helps the country in having a proactive and productive workforce that is reliable and efficient. It will work better in reducing the number of people falling sick as a result of lifestyle behaviours thereby reducing the burden of funding the health sector at both the local, regional and national levels.
Business Challenge: Funding is a big hindrance to the full implementation of the business. This is because the business requires sporting equipment and workout space that is relatively costly for me to manage as a start-up entrepreneur.
Programme Benefit: Financial support. This will make it a reality for the business as I will be able to put in place the necessary infrastructure for its full implementation. After kick-starting the business, it will be able to fund itself from the proceeds levied on the clients.
Programme Participation:
Making Youth related activities an all-season project. This will keep the youths more engaged and informed by always checking up on what they are doing. _x000D_
Having Ambassadors of the program will as well help in selling the program among the youths.
Programme Measures: This can be done by actively recruiting ambassadors and representatives from the most basic civic levels to the national level. For more engagements of the youths as well, National Youth Council needs to have a framework of forming clubs at various learning institutions in order to keep the youthful population more informed and engaged.

I also would like to develop other revenue streams within the sugarcane sector like the purchase and sale of sugarcane for profit and providing winching services to my competitors whenever their tractors get stuck._x000D_
I started operations in December 2020.
Business Customers: I sell sugarcane to Sukari Industries. I'm contracted by them so I'm assured of a market for my product. With transport, my clients are fellow farmers both private and contracted who don't have their own means of transport.
Product Solution:
Many farmers are stuck with their mature sugarcane in their farms because they lack means of transport. The company has very few tractors hence limited capacity. This is where I come in. I'm contracted by the company to supplement their tractors. I provide these services at a cost to the farmer._x000D_
Demand for sugar in Kenya far outstrips supply. This forces the country to import sugar to plug the deficit. Supply currently stands at 600,000 tons against a demand of about 900,000 tons.  Increased cane production will go a long way towards enabling the country be self-sufficient as regards sugar.
Business Challenge: The infrastructure in sugarcane growing areas in poor. Poor roads mean we're not able to deliver sugarcane on time. This becomes worse during the rainy season where we have frequent cases of getting stuck in the mud. To mitigate this, I plan to purchase a winching tractor that pulls stuck tractors. There is currently no winching tractor in our area.
Programme Benefit:
I have brilliant ideas as to how I can improve my venture but the biggest challenge I face is capital. I hope to get access to funding. This will enable me expand my business and be in a position to employ more people. Currently, I have 7 employees, 5 being youth under 30 years._x000D_
I also would like to be mentored by seasoned business people. This will help me enhance my entrepreneurial skills. I also would want to have somebody to keep me in check and act like an accountability partner.
Reffered By: Online Search (ie Google), Word of Mouth
Programme Participation: Expand their reach especially in the rural areas. Majority of the youth have never heard of the National Youth Council. Use mediums like radio especially these vernacular stations to communicate and reach out to the youth.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Environment, Agriculture
Programme Measures:
Close to 75% of the Kenyan population comprises the youth. However, majority of them are unemployed. You should come up with initiatives that will engage the youth in gainful activities and these should be on a regular basis. There also many youth government agencies. These should be consolidated in to one body in order to reduce duplicity and eliminate the red tape that comes with government._x000D_
There should be strict monitoring and evaluation of the performance of youth initiatives as these have been prone to abuse especially by the officials charged with implementing them.

Name: Kelvin Willy Mulama
Business Description:
We are disrupting Shopkeeper lending using a new lending model with Artificial Intelligence. _x000D_
_x000D_
Kitabu Africa is introducing a remotely accessible AI enabled mobile app called Shoplend, that empowers shopkeepers to become digital lenders, enabling 23 Million Kenyans to be able to buy goods on credit during time of emergencies at their shops._x000D_
_x000D_
We are building the next generation platform for digital and mobile-first commerce. We believe by using modern technology, the very best engineering talent, and a mission-driven approach we can reinvent the payment experience at our shops in Kenya and beyond. Our solution, which is built on trust and transparency, make it easier for consumers to spend, purchase on credit responsibly and with confidence, easier for shopkeepers to convert sales and grow, and easier for commerce in Kenya to thrive._x000D_
_x000D_
Legacy payment options, archaic systems, and traditional risk and credit underwriting models can be harmful, deceptive, and restrictive to both consumers and merchants. They are not well-suited for increasingly digital and mobile-first commerce, and are built on legacy infrastructure that does not support the innovation required for modern commerce to evolve and flourish._x000D_
_x000D_
Our platform addresses these problems. Today, it comprises three core elements: a point-of-sale payment solution for consumers, merchant commerce solutions, and a consumer-focused app._x000D_
Our point-of-sale solution allows consumers to pay for purchases in fixed amounts without deferred interest, hidden fees, or penalties. _x000D_
_x000D_
Business Customers:
We empower consumers to pay over time rather than paying for a product entirely upfront. This increases consumers’ purchasing power and gives them more control and flexibility. Our platform facilitates both true 0% APR payment options and interest bearing loans. With 0% APR, consumers pay zero interest and zero additional costs. On the interest bearing loans we facilitate, we charge simple interest, which means consumers pay fixed amounts of interest that they agree to up front, and the interest never compounds. _x000D_
_x000D_
We believe in treating people fairly, which is why consumers never pay more than what was agreed to at checkout, even if they miss a payment. Paying with Shoplend not only protects consumers from hidden fees but allows them to avoid traps such as deferred interest._x000D_
_x000D_
We offer merchants highly effective commerce solutions that enhance demand generation and customer acquisition. Our solutions empower merchants to more efficiently promote and sell their products, optimize their customer acquisition strategies, and drive incremental sales. Our flexible payment solutions allow merchants to solve affordability for their customers, providing a revenue accelerator while avoiding discounting and other expensive marketing and promotional channels. We also provide valuable product-level data and insights — information that merchants cannot easily get elsewhere — to better inform their marketing strategies. Our approach allows us to add value throughout the full customer lifecycle, from acquisition, to conversion, to repeat transactions._x000D_
_x000D_
Our consumer-focused app unlocks the full suite of shoplend's products for a delightful end-to-end consumer experience. Consumers can use our app to manage payments, open a high-yield savings account, and access a personalized marketplace. Our marketplace serves as a discovery platform which allows consumers to find products and make purchases from partner merchants. In addition our app allows merchants to provide tailored offers based on consumers’ spending patterns, shopping habits, and purchase intent.
Product Solution:
Merchants are currently facing rising customer acquisition costs, and existing solutions are insufficient_x000D_
The cost to acquire a customer and the cost to convert a sale are two of the biggest challenges facing merchants, and these costs are rising across almost every channel. Current payment solutions do little to help merchants attract and retain customers, forcing merchants to turn to discounts or promotional gimmicks. Alternative customer acquisition and marketing channels, such as online and social media advertising, are increasingly expensive due to the limited supply of digital ad space. As a result, both brick-and-mortar and online merchants of all sizes are looking to alternative strategies to acquire, convert, and retain customers more efficiently._x000D_
Not only are merchants experiencing challenges in running their business but consumers as well arefacing payment option challenges to satisfy their wants;This includes;_x000D_
Limitations of legacy offerings_x000D_
For consumers, when it comes to the act of making a purchase, there are a number of shortcomings with existing options:_x000D_
They are Complex,Providers have a Predatory lending mindset,Mispriced credit risk,Inflexible,Impersonal and a frustrating user experience_x000D_
​_x000D_
For merchants, when it comes to acquiring customers, improving conversions, and increasing order values, there are also a number of shortcomings with existing options:_x000D_
Difficulty in engaging and converting customers, Lack of viable consumer-friendly solutions that address unaffordability, Offering discounts can harm merchants’ brands, Abandoned carts , Lack of purchase intelligence, Limited benefits to existing payment networks_x000D_
​_x000D_
Our Solution_x000D_
SHoplend is transforming the way consumers buy and merchants do business through a platform consisting of honest financial products. We are starting our business with our core pay-over-time solution at checkout, as we continued to innovate and expand our product suite. And, this is just the beginning.
Business Challenge:
The cost to meet regulatory and compliance needs,_x000D_
We are offering support to youth led business by providing a free offer  that provides their businesses with an online store that is integrated with our payment system, we have five youth led businesses already that we are onboarding and it is expensive hence we need more support to meet development costs
Programme Benefit:
Mentorship on how I can comply with regulatory standards that have been setup to regulate digital banking and Fintech_x000D_
_x000D_
A link to the Capital markets authority and the insurance regulatory authority to enable me be part of their testing sandbox _x000D_
_x000D_
Funding to help me meet the cost of development and expansion to other counties
Programme Participation:
To make the youth believe that, entrepreneurship means filling a curious mind with a passion for change. It’s about embarking on a journey of curiosity, one that is driven with passion for assessing gaps in our planet and curving a niche for themselves to fix them. Whether short or long, smooth or bumpy, exciting or dull, the end goal for this journey for the youth  is a fulfilled heart for doing something greater for mankind and for a better world. The humility of knowing this should be used to  motivates them to always arm themselves with two things: curiosity of mind and passion of heart, for they are the drivers of the entrepreneurial journey, no matter how bumpy it becomes._x000D_
_x000D_
With this mindset a clear framework should be made to ensure every primary, high schools and higher level institution together with Churches have Innovation boot camps on a weekly basis. I can also be helpful in coming up with such a framework_x000D_
Programme Measures: Organize Innovation boot camps that culminate into an innovation week in each county

Name: ABBYSAI AYOMA
Business Description: We want to resell Internet and provide data related solutions to the residents of Vihiga County and beyond. Vihiga County because the county is marginalised when it comes to getting affordable and reliable internet that will hasten their communication, research and studies just to mention a few.
Business Customers: Our business will anyone and everyone that wants to make use of internet. We have a target base of every individual with an internet enabled gadget from TVs to mobile phones and computers not forgetting machinery such as CCTV cameras. We have a broad market and we believe with our flexible mode of payment this will ensure that the business is sustainable and profitable at all fronts during and post Covid-19 pandemic.
Product Solution: We want to solve problems emanating from inflexible and unreliable internet that is vital and critical in online learning, research for agricultural sectors on modern farming methodologies and market trends. Providing unlimited and affordable data ensure that the the market saves when it comes to data and also make us of it. We will indirectly protect the environment ensuing that majority presently are traveling long distances to access data providers like cyber cafe who do so at high prices limiting the number of people doing research. We will also open avenues for people to start other forms of business such as cyber cafés, security industries, online conferencing etc. Furthermore we will ensure that majority stay at home during the pandemic that's slaying our country for internet will ensure that they communicate with the rest of the world easily. Finally but not least, with devolution in our counties, Omni Technologies will ensure that government offices access data to facilitate it's operations.
Business Challenge:
Having worked for such company in Nairobi, and considering the plight Vihiga residents are facing, biggest challenge isn't neither staff nor market base but the initial capital/investment costs. We have done all the feasibility studies and planning though implementing this Nobel idea remains s but a dream to come true. I strongly believe that we will be facilitated to kick-start and that we are the right persons to steer this forward. _x000D_
_x000D_
Inaccessibility to start-up capital hasn't deterred us from doing our studies on what is needed and engaging the market. We have done a lot especially in making sure that we have our data right and contacting companies that we will work in tandem with. With facilitation, this will not only be a dream come true but an advent for many other companies to start their operations.
Programme Benefit:
Mentorship will be key especially the market we will be getting in has other bigger giants who have been in existence for some time for example Safaricom. _x000D_
_x000D_
Second, capital is the biggest challenge we face. Be it a loan or a grand, we just wish to start when the market is raw. That's is the biggest elephant in our room that needs to be moved with your help/facilitation._x000D_
_x000D_
We are happy to state that, the delay in starting the business has been a blessing as well for we have identified how we can cut costs, how we can obtain cheaper machinery to give us similar services. We have created a relationship with some companies that we will work with even before we begin. We have identified a team we can work with in improving our market base and service delivery. We have grown knowledgewise

 _x000D_

or menu especially after working out. Mushroom delicacy will definitely come in _x000D_
handy._x000D_

rather than cooking. Kwa Mushroom Farm will also deliver well packed ready to eat _x000D_
different preparations of mushroom that will be beneficial in their bodies. _x000D_
• Our research suggests that those segments together represent a pool of more _x000D_
than 15,000 potential customers per day. Factor in the broad decline of the fast food industry, the complementary rising popularity of fast-casual options, the cool _x000D_
factor attached to innovative food trucks, and the town's strong population growth, _x000D_
and there is a great opportunity here.

'- Availability of nutritious food that is medicinal. Groups of people who have issues _x000D_

- Creation of job opportunities to women and girls who are jobless in the _x000D_

generation._x000D_

Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement
Business Description: What my business does is to allow unemployed or low-income individuals or groups of people to take reasonable small business loans safely, and in a manner that is consistent with ethical lending practices. This is all to ensure that the life of a common citizen is empowered.
Business Customers: The main target in my business are the  unemployed or low-income individuals or groups who would most probably have no access to other financial services. My business is basically focused on "common mwananchi".

Programme Benefit: The support i would like to get from this programme would be financial through funding my business to enable us serve more customers, employ more youths and grow together.  Training is another form of support I would like to get from this programme and more opportunities.

Name: Pauline Owiti
Business Description:
ORGANIC FARMING AND AGROFORESTRY_x000D_
Our goal at the Foundation is to train the community on the best practices of sustainable organic farming and agro forestry. _x000D_
In Siaya county and in Kenya as a whole, we have witnessed reduced crop yields due to nutrient depletion and loss of soil biodiversity. Non regenerative farming practices have caused the problems over the long term but more recently the over-use of agro chemicals as fertilizer and pest controls have made the problems worse._x000D_
_x000D_
And then there's  climate change._x000D_
_x000D_
 It's  not just the burning of fossil fuels that is causing global climate disruption,_x000D_
Large scale factory farming is also contributing   significantly to the problem._x000D_
 In my short lifetime I have witnessed additional crop failures due to the disruption  of our rainy seasons._x000D_
_x000D_
We believe that organic farming offers an alternative that can eliminate many of the environmental problems  caused by the contemporary, unsustainable agricultural practices. Instead of using petroleum derived chemicals to fertilize and protect crops, farmers learn to see more natural alternatives.  _x000D_
They learn how to use natural composts, mulches and bio insecticides/pesticides that recycle nutrients and control pests and weeds. _x000D_
They  lean about companion planting and permaculture. We are using crops and plants such as pyrethrum, garlic, red pepper to produce insecticides and pesticides that are environmentally friendly. _x000D_
_x000D_
At The Polly Foundation, our goal is to shift  towards the health and wellbeing of the community. To  restore the culture in agriculture.
Business Customers:
Our first customers for bio farm products will be the small scale farmers in Siaya County who are willing to adopt organic farming and will be using our products in there farms._x000D_
Secondly, we will be selling our products to families/households who will be buying at affordable prices.
Product Solution:
Our Bio farm products such as insecticides and pesticides will be solving the issue of increased prices of farm inputs such as agro-chemicals which are pest control inputs as well as solving the issue of soil biodiversity._x000D_
We shall also be solving the issue of soil fertility, whereby we will be using compost and mulches to improve soil fertility and the increasing prices of fertilizers._x000D_
Moreover, there are environmental issues that will be solved with the use of organic farming techniques.
Business Challenge:
Capital and administrative resources have been a major setback in the project._x000D_
We also need more research information in pesticides and insecticides sector._x000D_
More funds to employ more people in production._x000D_
Mentorship and training of our members.
Programme Benefit:
Mentorship and training on marketing and management techniques._x000D_
Sources of capital.
Programme Participation:
Providing platforms that have opportunities._x000D_
Facilitate there participation in terms of connectivity.
Programme Measures:
Partnerships between youth initiatives and government offices/entities._x000D_
Better policies that support youth initiatives._x000D_
Youth empowerment initiatives from government. _x000D_

Business Description: I am working on a mobile gadget that is to be designed to measure the safeness of the farm products by measuring the amount of  toxins present as a result of chemical pesticide applied during the time of plantation up to the time of harvest, before getting their way into the market.

Fresh farm produce vendors._x000D_
Quality assurance and regulatory bodies._x000D_
Fresh firm produce consumers.
Product Solution:
'-It will help in reducing the consumption of toxins in the fresh farm produce grown by the use of farm chemicals which will hence reduce the spread of the NCDs or diseases of affluence._x000D_
-Fresh unprocessed vegetables and animal products consumed day to day, do not often go through quality check because of a short supply chain, they are highly perishable, and the farmers and vendors lack access to infrastructure for quality check. Such infrastructure is available to industry processed food, and facilitated by Kenya Bureau of Standards. _x000D_
_x000D_
-The quality of the unprocessed food depends on the food growing methods and the environment. However, the quality cannot be ascertained without testing. This creates a possibility of toxin-related health risks in foods consumed with high toxin levels. _x000D_

Name: Michael  Omondi Odongo
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Creative Economy, Manufacturing
Business Description:
LAVIMIK  ENGINEERING SOLUTIONS mainly deals in services provision and installation of various equipment to companies and individuals.  This is inclusive of:_x000D_
Air conditioning and refrigeration- offering of repairs and maintenance services and installations of air conditioners of various types and troubleshooting of refrigerators both at home levels and in large scale companies._x000D_
_x000D_
Electronics repair and electrical maintenance- Help our customer with fault finding and system upgrade and system upgrade of and repair and maintenance of electrical appliances inclusive of washing machines, home heaters, _x000D_
Kitchen appliances- Servicing and repair of various kitchen appliances inclusive of microwaves, electric heaters, blenders, electric cookers, ovens_x000D_
_x000D_
 Sale of simple home appliances and their components- Electric kettles, water heaters, blenders, iron boxes, electric fans, electric coils
Business Customers:
Kisumu is a growing low-to-middle-class area, counting close to 1 million residents and most of these residents are families of three or more. There are many growing businesses and families that have mastered the use of technological way of doing things by the use of electrical appliances for various purposes. These products require regular servicing, repair and in some cases replacement thus the need to come up with this business._x000D_
With the available population and the continued growth in the area, the opportunity to serve Kisumu county residents will gradually increase. I estimate that around 60% of our services and products will be channeled to individuals with e other 40% targeting institutions such as school, hotels, hospitals and companies._x000D_
Based on the currently available engineering services providers, most of them are located within the city centre and have not exploited markets in slums and other interior areas, as result there is prompt need to provide such services to the fast growing remote areas._x000D_
In addition, there is need for door to door services and repairs and various home appliances such as washing machines, by becoming available for home services, it will provide a platform for people to rely on our services. _x000D_
_x000D_
Most of the service provides I the market are either skilled and lack the necessary qualifications or have the necessary qualifications but lacks the required skills hence the need to venture into this market and provide qualified and skilled manpower to offer these services. This we do as we also enlighten those who are semi skilled to get the required qualifications._x000D_
_x000D_
Lastly, most people who sell electrical appliances normally do not offer installation and other after sale services, our aim is to ensure that we sell to our customers and help them with fitting of various appliances and teach them how to operate them.
Product Solution:
With the rise in technology in kenya and the upward drift of usage of electronics and electrical appliances at homes, hotels and institutions, there is need to  come up with a business that will ensure constant supply of efficient skilled  technicians to offer repairs and installation services of both refrigeration and air conditioning systems and electrical appliances._x000D_
Most technicians who are available are either semi skilled or rather not qualified. This therefore calls for creating a pool of individuals who have the skills and necessary qualifications to handle such appliance. _x000D_
In addition, many youths  find it difficult to transit from technical instututions to the job markets due to the high rates of unemployment.  This has therefore necessitated me to come up with this business in order to create employment for self and other young  people coming from polytechnices and colleges and find it diffucult to be absorbed with companies._x000D_

Name: Sharon Onyango
Which School: Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology
Business Description:
Providing sustainable solution to pavement construction in order to reduce urban heat island effects and enhance flood management in urban areas._x000D_
_x000D_
Our venture aims at addressing SDG 11 and SDG 13.
Business Customers:
To curb both the urban heat island effects in hot seasons and urban flooding in rainy seasons, we came up with a sustainable solution. We developed eco-friendly paving blocks that allow water to pass through them, while promoting air-soil heat exchange thereby reducing urban temperatures._x000D_
_x000D_
Our venture is a B2B and our target customers are:_x000D_
1. Landscape and Urban planners_x000D_
2. Construction Project managers_x000D_
3. Real Estate property developers
Product Solution:
Urbanization rate currently stands at 55% with a potential increase to 68% in 2050, so is the case of Kenya. The process has turned natural areas to built areas with and about 70% are impermeable causing floods and Urban Heat Islands. In extreme cases, the urban heat may affect the urban residents hence deteriorating their health. Additionally, the floods cause displacements, diseases, deaths among others, affecting the urban residents. _x000D_
_x000D_
Our idea which is currently a product already has numerous innovative and unique approaches to solving the urban heat and flooding problems. It can:_x000D_
_x000D_
•Reduce air temperatures. This means that the human thermal comfort for the urban residents will be improved. _x000D_
•It has a high infiltration rate thereby allowing floodwater to go through them. The water can be collected in reservoirs for later use. _x000D_
•The product promotes ground water recharge as it goes down beyond the pavement. _x000D_
•It also improves water quality as the flood water goes through a different stone aggregate beneath and can be recycled for other uses.
Business Challenge:
Inefficiency due to the use of manual machines._x000D_
If we'd get a financial boost to shift to automated machines, production will be high and efficient.
Programme Benefit:
1. Networking through the various workshops_x000D_
2. Sharpen my Presentation and Leadership skills_x000D_
3. Co-creations, and Mentorship _x000D_
4. Financial aid to boost our start up venture
Programme Participation:
1. Strategic partnerships with the already existing youth groups depending on the initiative_x000D_
2. Provide beneficial incentives that will boost the youths career-wise e.g., Internships, Awards, Certification etc_x000D_
3. Innovative volunteerism: Offer volunteer opportunities with stipends if available_x000D_
4. Carry out community workshops and trainings within different local communities to reach the grass root._x000D_
5. Offer mentorship_x000D_
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Creative Economy, Environment, Manufacturing
Programme Measures: Partner with the local like-minded organizations since they already have set-base within their respective counties.

Name: Evans Odhiambo
Business Description: My service is household delivery of fresh vegetables. The fresh produce comes from farms around the county already with vegetables. The main concept is to ensure homesteads get vegetables at any time of the day without necessarily accessing the market. This will save homesteads the cost of transport to markets and will provide them a range of fresh organic products by a click of a button. I am into this because there is a high demand for fresh products in Kisumu which mainly come from counties outside the Nyanza region. The quick acquisition of farm products will see motivation of farmers within Kisumu hence increased farming activities due to market availability. I believe there is a gap in farming in Kisumu and its environs hence the need to introduce efficient farm products delivery that will lead to increased farm output in the long run by contracting farmers. My business hence solves the agricultural equation by delivering products to households and institutions
Business Customers: My vegetable delivery business is serving households in the different existing and emerging  estates of Kisumu county. My business also seeks to serve hotels, restaurants and institutions like schools and hospitals within the county.  These institutes are huge consumers of vegetables which go through hurdles to access fresh farm products
Product Solution: Households in Kisumu buy farm products in markets places which are  perceived to be so congested a no go zone especially in these times of the pandemic. Farmers take their products to the market through middlemen who sell the products at a doubled price hence customers buy at exorbitant prices. My business does away with the middlemen since it takes these products directly to houses. This enables people to buy products at cheap prices. My businesses also saves people the hectic work of going to market places thus saving on time and transport costs because delivery is done at the doorstep. Institutions will have fresh products delivered to them without going through the hustle and bustle of markets
Business Challenge: My business lacks a good premises for storage, sorting and packaging my products. It also lacks a cooler to ensure my products don't go bad after picking from farmers. My business is also seeking good transport mechanisms to enable me pick products from farms and deliver to households with ease
Programme Benefit: I would like the program to provide me trainings on best model that will enable me operate with ease. Other trainings on marketing, financial recording and branding will be essential too. My business is also seeking financial support to help me establish a good premise and purchase a motorcycle for transport

Name: ESTHER AKINYI ORUKO
Business Description:
I plan on getting into the fruit and vegetable drying business, to be specific mango drying. Now drying is one of the oldest methods of food preservation. Fruit drying is basically the removal of water from foods so that the growth of micro-organisms is inhibited. All the mango fruits should be ripe and free from_x000D_
bruising. Any rotten or bruised fruit should be thrown away. The fruits will then be washed, peeled and cut into different slices in preparation for the drying process. Fruit pieces are then arranged on mesh-bottom trays so that they are not touching or overlapping. The fruit should be loaded into the trays as soon as it is cut. This prevents the pieces from_x000D_
sticking together and allows the drying process to start as soon as possible. The trays should be brushed and cleaned to remove any old fruit pieces. The dried fruits are then packaged immediately after drying to prevent them absorbing moisture_x000D_
from the surrounding air.
Business Customers:
1. school students-will be sold to them as snacks_x000D_
2. People at the various bus stations- also sold to them as snacks_x000D_
3. Majorly it will be an export product to countries like Japan and China. Since there is a high demand for dried mango chips from these mentioned countries according to the Ministry of Agriculture Kenya._x000D_
4.
Product Solution: 1. Dried mango fruits solves the market-access problem. Most of these fruits are unavailable off season and therefore they are not found, but when dried, they have a longer shelf life and therefore being available for purchase even off season._x000D_
Business Challenge: The biggest challenge is limited funds to run  the business and challenges in accessing the export market.
Programme Benefit:
1. Financial support in managing the day to day operations of the business. _x000D_
2. Getting relevant linkages to the export market._x000D_
3. Assistance in purchasing a solar dryer.
Programme Participation: By engaging the youth during initial stages of there policy formulation.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Creative Economy, Environment, Technology, Manufacturing, Agriculture
Programme Measures: To tap, nurture and mentor youth groups at the grassroot level.

Name: BAKANJA JACOB KIMONGO
Which School: Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology
Business Description: My business entails purchasing goods like imported ready-made clothes both male and female wear from wholesalers and selling them at retail.  The business also entails purchasing of shoes for the same purpose. the clothes are both for official and casual wear.
Business Customers: My business will serve both students and community members around Kakamega. My business will be located at Kakamega CBD which is a strategic business point where most of my customers visit. Students from Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology, as well as other institutions, will be my main customers together with the residents of the town. Kakamega being a metropolitan town/municipality it harbors residents from all walks of life and this will be an advantage to me in terms of customers.
Product Solution:
My business is trying to bridge the gap between the different levels of the social classes. This gap is majorly brought about due to the fact that most of the youth within the town feel misplaced in terms dressing due to the prices of quality clothes being offered by other retailers. my business seeks to bridge this gap by offering quality clothes for better prices without jeopardizing the other businesses .  My products will be of standard quality and they will be offered at affordable prices to enable everyone afford them thus bridging the gap between the haves and the less fortunate which in the end promotes equality._x000D_
my business will also try as much to solve the problem of social immoralities like rape and defilement majorly caused by immoral dressing codes. my products will be of decent nature thus liked by many. _x000D_
with this business the economy of this region will improve through paying taxes to the government and once the economy of the county improves, that of the whole country also improves.

Name: Virgyl Ochieng
Business Description:
It is fintech initiative that offers savings services. Currently we only major in this plans to expand our operations to other services like loaning, mortgaging among other financial services._x000D_
For now we are doing a service dubbed MBAO SAVING-PLAN where our clients save at least KES 20 daily with no set maximum. We provide them with timely updates and reminders on the need to remain consistent. We also award diligent savers periodically and this has acted as a great motivating factor to them. We have since seen more clients being brought by other clients who are satisfied with our services and feel it is a good initiative. Technological infrastructure of this is still work-in-progress that has been slowed down by insufficient resources, but we will sure get there.
Business Customers: The MBAO SAVING-PLAN targets students in the colleges and employees of the informal sector. Name: Trezer Were
Business Description:
'- It is a container that has been divided into shops. One of the shops I have is a salon, the other shop has a boutique and my mother as a fashion designer makes tailored clothes for selling as well in the shop. The boutique so has ready made clothes and tailored clothes as well. The same boutique shop as a way of having more income generating activities, we sell ice that we make overnight and put in the freezer to sell. We also sell sodas, both cold and warm sodas._x000D_
- The same boutique also has a peanut butter making machine that we make peanut butter for selling too in the village. We are hoping that the other divided sides of the container gets clients for renting, but so far we have 2 shops that one is a boutique and the other is salon. We only one have client  that has rented one of the free spaces in the container, hopefully we will get more clients to rent out_x000D_
- My mother also makes bought a motorbike to assist bring in more income to cover up for the dry days, at least a motorbike cannot have totally dry days
Business Customers:
'- Community people in the village. They buy soda, peanut, ice and pay for motorbike rides_x000D_
- School children on most occasions buy ice_x000D_
- Women and ladies mostly buy the tailored clothes and ready made clothes_x000D_
Product Solution:
'- At times in the village it gets too hot, the ice really helps to quench people's thirst especially for the school going students and even the vendors in the market. The cold soda and ice really comes through for people in the extra sunny days in the village, which is most times._x000D_
- The soda also is really bought by clients who buy chips from the nearby clients. Since the shop is just in the market entrance, it operates as a stop shop from most people to rest and soda is what they buy as the wait_x000D_
- The area does not have an instant peanut butter maker machine, the people in the village mostly grind the nuts using their hands, so the peanut machine really comes in handy. Most people even bring in their nuts for us to make them or they just purchase the whole peanut butter ready made from us._x000D_
- Since it is a village, getting ready made clothes one has to go to the city to purchase, but we buy and take it to them to the village_x000D_
- My mother as a fashion designer who has been a tutor for several years in NGOs, comes in with her creativity in making better clothes than the normal designers in the village. Clients have been stocking the shop because of her creative designs in tailoring_x000D_
- The salon is still growing, it is still not gaining as much clients since it is rather new but with time will get there, because the area does not have very good equipment in salons, but since we transferred the salon we had in Kisumu to the village, the one we have is equipped_x000D_
- The village is interiorly placed, you have to board a motorbike to get to Kendu bay or any nearby market area
Business Challenge:
'- We are located in the village, there is so many challenges in the village. This is because in the village most times the community members are not buying, you have to wait for market days or be ready to walk to clients in their homesteads and tell them to buy which at times they do not buy even if you do._x000D_
- You have to be ready to go an extra mile than the normal to get your business running._x000D_
- Most market days the business does well but since we depend on the market days, not all turn out as expected, so we have to make sure we have multiple ways of oncome_x000D_
- We have one motorbike that is in good condition but at times it is the only source of income for the day yet you have to  make sure the rider gets his commission as well
Programme Benefit: Because of the tough conditions that we at times go through to make ends meet, of which we are okay of going an extra mile to get it work, I would also love if we could get support financially to assist boost the business either get more motorcycles or boost both shops with products needed and do more marketing
Programme Participation: If National Youth Council can give more jobs to the youth and give good opportunities to volunteer in, that will help them gain more experience and get better networks to help them grow, then they would love to be engaged because most youth are unemployed and without motivation then participating in initiatives becomes difficult
Programme Measures: In my County the youths need to be educated, and even after getting education.. there needs to be internship opportunities and community trainings in business development to help them raise funds to sustain themselves and grow themselves and their families

Name: Paul Okello
Business Description:
Greenvision is an agribusiness enterprise looking to venture in hydroponic farming. Greenvision is a youth-initiated enterprise that aims at creating more jobs for youths while solving the problem of food insecurity._x000D_
Given the fast-growing global population, food security has become a priority. However, Greenvision aims at a sustainable agricultural practices that preserves the environment and ensure healthy products for customers. Evidence shows that hydroponic farming is capable of preserving up to 90% of water in agriculture, thus conserving more water for domestic and industrial use. Compared to the traditional method, hydroponic farming can increase yield up 3 to 10 times using the same space. Further, it allows for organic farming and easier pest control when undertaken in a controlled environment._x000D_
Business Customers: Agricultural products are salable to the general public, hospitality industry ( e.g hotels, restaurants), healthcare facilities (hospitals, clinics, community health centers), vendors and retailers (supermarkets, vegetable shops)
Product Solution:
Food insecurity_x000D_
We aim to provide access to enough food for active and healthy life
Business Challenge:
Inadequate resources_x000D_
The ambitious venture notwithstanding, Greenvision is a small enterprise that still suffers the resources inadequacy. The lacking resources include_x000D_
Financial recourse_x000D_
Enough agricultural land_x000D_
Support structures for hydroponic farming_x000D_
Enough human resource
Programme Benefit:
Advanced training and mentorship in hydroponic farming technique_x000D_
Financial support to acquires the needed resources for enabling the farming technique
