Name: Gordon Omala
Business Description:
THIRO CHAN KOCHIA PINNEAPLE LIMITED is going to address pineapple production and availability to sellers at the local Olare Centre in Kochia,  a center that has been known for selling of pineapples for a very long time now._x000D_
Many families around this area have been surviving on hawking of pineapples, Most of these sellers, who are women and mothers, have however resolved to this business as their last resort, a concern that has captured my attention._x000D_
Come to think of it, if this business has been taking place for years and years, why would people do it only because they have no other option? Pineapples sellers have regarded and believed that they are a poor category of the Kochia society, and for this reason originates the onset of THIRO CHAN LIMITED which has a direct translation of "stagnating poverty" within Kochia pineapple sellers at Olare Centre._x000D_
The company will receive pineapples directly from farmers, Unlike the current situation where the sellers themselves reach out to the farmers, an issue that has resulted shortage of pineapples due to reduced sale of pineapples as a result of increased prices which sellers shift to the customers to match the cost of availing the pineapples._x000D_
RHIRO CHAN will out source for pineapples both locally within Kochia and other regions within the country where pineapples are produced and sell it to pineapple retailers at affordable prices._x000D_
There is no juice production at Olare Centre even with its good name of producing a very sweet fruit. It is to the interest of THIRO CHAN that pineapple juice production is going to be achievable within Kochia, an opportunity that will help create employment to some of the local people. This I believe will help improve the living standards of some people, both economically and healthily._x000D_
There is going to be a  welfare group within my business, that is going to be one that is constituted by the pineapple sellers, one where they can address challenges that they are facing along side the recommendations that they have concerning pineapple production._x000D_
THIRO CHAN has a long term focus of doing large scale production of pineapples in the near future, after which setting up a pineapple factory in Kochia, something that has been a dream to most of the women selling this fruit. It is the aim of this business set up a place where pineapple sellers might rely on when economic conditions hit the rock.
Business Customers:
THIRO CHAN KOCHIA PINEAPPLE LIMITED will serve local Centre pineapple sellers at Olare. It will also produce pineapple juice that will help serve the local community and even the entire region._x000D_
The pineapple seller at Olare Centre is one that has loosed hope in success and in becoming wealthy people. Most sell pineapples in order to get daily meals, and whatever they earn is never enough to support their bills._x000D_
The biggest target market for these women are passengers on vehicles.
Product Solution:
The business intends majorly to improve the image of pineapple business and increase the hope of families within Kochia, prove to them that there life conditions can still be better even in the pineapple industry._x000D_
The business intends to achieve this by becoming a lead player in dealing with market conditions on behalf of sellers, avail pineapples when required, at convenient prices and from convenient farmers._x000D_
THIRO CHAN seeks to be a relief for Kochia women and families that sell pineapples for a hand to mouth survival._x000D_
The business also intends to employ some individuals from the local community, more so youths, who are idle and jobless. There is an intention of helping the government curb social problems within the area by improving youth employment.
Business Challenge: Unavailability of capital to start and grow the business.
Programme Benefit: Get funding from the program to help achieve my goal.
Reffered By: Online Search (ie Google), Word of Mouth
Programme Participation: NYC should develop a youth data base, having youths contacts and continuously notify youths on the importance of participation in youth programs.
Programs Interested: Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Creative Economy, Manufacturing, Agriculture, Education
Programme Measures: appointments of youth regional representatives from as low as constituency level to the national level to help intergrade the initiative system.

Name: Dancan Otieno Onyango
Business Description: A agribusiness venture focusing on integrated commercial farming in the area of dairy and poultry in an area where such opportunities have not been explored as in other parts of Kenya such as Central Kenya and parts of Rift Valley. We seek to employ modern technology and equipment to optimize productivity so as to make agriculture a viable business venture and an alternative career line given the prevailing wave of unemployment in Kenya. The business seeks to manufacture dairy and poultry feeds from locally available raw materials for use in its own model farm (already established in Rongo town) and for sale as another line of business. The business then looks forward to using its model to mentor, train and empower educated youth and youth groups in Nyanza region to adopt agriculture as a career. In summary, direct farm products are eggs, milk, chicken, beef, and animal feeds while the main target service is training and empowering unemployed educated youth in the area of agribusiness.
Business Customers:
1. The main farm produce - eggs, milk and meat will be sold locally in Rongo town and its environs in the area of South Nyanza, including Homabay, Kisii, Migori and Kisumu Counties. _x000D_
_x000D_
2. Animal Feeds will also be sold locally at affordable prices to youth and youth groups under training as well as in the local markets to other farmers. _x000D_
_x000D_
3. Training and Mentoring Services target the youth, particularly the growing number of unemployed educated youth in the country who have graduated from colleges and universities but cannot find jobs.
Product Solution:
1. Shortage of locally produced fresh milk, milk products and organically-produced eggs in the South Nyanza region. Most families, even in remote villages now rely on packaged milk products from the shops which is costly. Eggs are either imported from Uganda or Central Kenya, making them expensive in the local markets. _x000D_
_x000D_
2. The high cost of animal feeds, which has discouraged many young people from venturing in commercial dairy and poultry farming in the region._x000D_
_x000D_
3. The rising number of educated unemployed youth in the region and in the country who still do not regard agribusiness as a potential viable line of alternative career
Business Challenge: Shortage of capital to expand the business by acquiring modern equipment and technology to boost production as envisaged in the original concept.
Programme Benefit:
1. Access to capital facilities to expand the business_x000D_
2. Training on how to stabilize startup businesses_x000D_
3. Networking
Programme Participation: Develop and empower regional chapters of NYC in every county/sub-county and empower them to reach out to youth in the grassroots.
Engamenet Ways: Voluntary work, Internships and work placements, Training
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement, Creative Economy, Environment, Manufacturing, Agriculture, Education
Programme Measures: Empower local chapters and chapter leaders and give opportunity to youth from the grassroots to participate in national initiatives. This needs to be done with a lot of investment in publicizing NYC initiatives on mainstream and social media.

Name: OTIENO DENIS OWUOR
Business Description: I do sugarcane farming. It takes a period of 18 months to get ready for harvesting. It requires a comprehensive management such as weeding ( 6 to 7 times), manure application (UREA, DAP) for effective results. Moreover, its very subject to striga weed which needs continuous management for better results. Sugarcane can be processed into sugar or "sukari ng ur u" .
Business Customers: I sell sugarcane to local sukari nguru manufacturers ( crusher). On the other hand, I sell it to sukari industries eg Sony Sugar or Riat Sugar Company.
Product Solution: For the community, its a source of living from the casual labour they offer at the Sukari Nguru factories. Morever, it provides sugar for the community after processing from the sugar companies.
Business Challenge:

Name: Irene Nyabeta Ondara
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Technology, Education
Business Description:
The business main focus is to offer specialized IT training. The trainees also get opportunity to share knowledge after the training in what is is termed us mentorship. The business has a "Hub" segment where  mentorship is done for a period of 1 year after completion of the training. _x000D_
_x000D_
The main target of the business is the youth population who are doing IT courses in any education level, those that have graduated and those that have an interest in getting a specialized IT in any of these areas:_x000D_
1. Software Development _x000D_
2. Graphics Design and Video Editing _x000D_
3. Hardware Maintenance _x000D_
4. Web Development_x000D_
5. Customer Management_x000D_
_x000D_
The business has a programme to inspire young learners in secondary schools by sponsoring Computer Contest for Kisii County Schools where the best students get awards and scholarships to come and learn after their O-level.
Business Customers:
The business mainly serves young people interested in developing a specific skill in IT. This doesn't lock out any other age from seeking the specialized training._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also interest in growing a young generation in primary and secondary schools into choosing IT as a career of choice. This is achieved though contests, bootcamps and motivational talks.
Product Solution:
In our community, there is a skills gap upon doing skills gap analysis among the youth in colleges and those that had graduated. It was discovered that many graduates in IT have no speciality in any area of IT posing a concern on whether their IT knowledge can help them solve a challenge in  the society. _x000D_
_x000D_
The business therefore offers specialized training to bridge this gap. It is overwhelming how this approach of the business has been embraced by the youth population.
Business Challenge: The business faces financial challenges to get a spacious training space, buying computers for training and buying of professional software for training. There is also need for projectors. Currently a trainee must come with a laptop from which s/he can attempt tasks given. At times some laptops have lower specifications for instance in running heavy programs like Adobe Premiere for video editing.
Programme Benefit:
Funding to facilitate purchase of_x000D_
1. Laptops for training_x000D_
3. Softwares for training_x000D_
4. 2 containers to customize to act as a training center in order to reduce or eliminate paying rent for the business._x000D_
5. 3 projectors_x000D_
Programme Participation:
1. Create awareness across the country by having scheduled youth programmes in the mainstream media._x000D_
2. Set up a youth resource center in every constituency where the youth can access information online, physical notice boards and physical council publications and other government write ups. _x000D_
3. MPs to facilitate dissemination of information within their jurisdictions. For instance, periodically running programmes eg KYEOP_x000D_
4. Create a dynamic and uptodate online platform as a repository for youth to obtain information. _x000D_
5. Identify bloggers to spread the NYC activities and programmes online.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Technology, Education

NYC offices in the counties with a budget to intensify awareness and activities in the counties.

Name: VINCENT OENGA
Business Description:
The business VINCENT CURTAINS domiciled in SHENGEN AFRIQUE LIMITED is a business enterprise that deals with the brand of the WINDOW COVERINGS for houses for sale._x000D_
The idea is premised on these two observation as follows: In my 2 years of legal practice at MONG’ARE BW’OKONG’O & ADVOCATES as a Legal Junior active in Property Law, I observed that mainstream Real Estate Companies vend houses on off-plan transactions, so impelling Buyers to institute lawsuits due to failed agreements including the interior finishing and window covering. (Features of “Antitrust” & “Breach of Contract”) _x000D_
This substantial thought is associated to a business Journal, The New York Times business (Real Estate) “Unattractive window coverings do little to create a positive impression at your home for sale and can actually do more harm than good when it is time to sell “Said Jennifer Ferland, a Real Estate Agent with A.C. LAWRENCE & COMPANY._x000D_
Just think about houses for sale with the identical contemporary architectural plan BUT with UNATTRACTIVE WINDOW COVERING! Think of impression! Think of billions of dollars incurred in the construction of the house without hasty selling! Think of competition from other Companies! _x000D_
VINCENT CURTAINS have talented discoverers who have expertise in selecting handy and attractive curtains. We take on a 1-2-week exploration on preferred operation system, overall style, colour and fabric preferences._x000D_
Business Customers:
SHENGEN AFRIQUE LIMITED (Youth Enterprise Company) is a supplies company. It takes our design and production team a 1-2-week study to come up with a desirable fabric preference for our customers. In a study of 50 houses, only 5 perchance will tell the curtain of their favourite as the situation to the Real Estate developers, relatively viewpoint to the architecture of the house, nonetheless, imperfect to the window covering fabric preference and colour to influence the buyer._x000D_
We have a team of trained sewers who stitch the curtains into unique fabric preference, colour for trade in certain, Real Estate developers and Government procuring institutions/offices. _x000D_
Product Solution: Just think about houses for sale with the identical contemporary architectural plan BUT with UNATTRACTIVE WINDOW COVERING! Think of impression! Think of billions of dollars incurred in the construction of the house without hasty selling! Think of competition from other Companies!
Business Challenge:
Reduced Buyer-supplier relationship due to economic complications._x000D_
Competition_x000D_
Inadequate resources

Name: Edison Nyachwaya Ongaro
Business Description:
Sage Graphics and Packaging specializes in creating packaging solutions to entrepreneurs and small businesses who cannot afford to procure packaging materials from big manufacturers who do large volumes of packaging materials for large enterprises. _x000D_
We at Sage Graphics and Packaging take it upon ourselves to come up with packaging concepts and branding, then use our creativity to produce packaging material at an affordable price. For example a youth who has just started a fruit export business might find it hard to come up with the branding on the packaging boxes as well as finding a high quality packaging material for the fruits. Our work is creating designs for the brand as well as sourcing for materials such as corrugated cartons which we then brand, cut and create a beautiful, strong and durable carton packaging for that small fruit selling/export business._x000D_
Therefore, our business, focuses on branding and creation of packaging materials.
Business Customers:
My business will focus on young entrepreneurs who are trying to introduce their product to the market, and need high quality branded packaging which will give them an edge against established brands in the market. _x000D_
My target customers lie especially in young people selling manufactured products like hand sanitizers, masks, detergents and soaps which need to be well branded and packaged with high quality material to give them a competing chance with already established brands in the market.
Product Solution:
When starting this journey to self-employment during the start of this year (2021), I noticed a lot of young people who lost their jobs due to the Corona pandemic were all starting businesses. One of the key challenge these businesses faced was the lack of proper branding and packaging of their products in a manner that would attract and satisfy the customer's confidence in the product. In most of the cases many youths ventured into the sale of hand sanitizers. These hand sanitizers were of high quality, the problem was poor and shabby looking packaging which cannot attract an average customer. For example established brands such as Velvex, had better looking packaging than what most youths offered their customers. Because of poor looking packaging, many businesses formed by these youths could not get sufficient market share for their products to survive. At times supermarkets and other retailers rejected their products as substandard just because of the poor looking packaging._x000D_
Besides, youths starting fruit export business find it a challenge to procure high quality corrugated cartons which can carry Avocados or Bananas (which are bulky) to meet the export standard. Companies in Kenya who sell this cartons are big packaging firms who focus on big players that buy in large quantities, therefore, somebody with small quantities is not able to find this product. Sage Graphics and Packaging will buy in large quantities this cartons, then cut and brand to its many small customers.
Business Challenge: The biggest challenge Sage Graphics and Packaging faces is the acquisition of printers and die-cutting machines that print and shape these packaging materials to the clients specification.
Programme Benefit: Sage Graphics and Packaging would like to receive financial help to purchase printing and Die-cutting machines that are integral to a packaging solutions business.
Programme Participation: The National Youth Council should continue finding better ways of communicating to the youth so that their programs are known to the youth. Most youths in this country have never heard of the National Youth Council, yet it has programs that could benefit them directly.
Other Ways: Issuence of capital to boost my business
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement, Creative Economy, Technology, Manufacturing
Programme Measures: The National Youth Council should partner with local leaders, such as chiefs and Members of county Assemblies who would help them in reaching out to many youths who have no idea what National Youth Council does or what it stands for.

Name: Rabbi Mwendwa
Business Description:
Agriculture is a major backbone to the economy of Kenya,thus a key and vital area for investment, economic growth and variety of opportunities. This field encompasses a vicious chain to be followed to aid in the maintenance of food sufficiency, meeting consumer demands and growth of the Nations GDP. Within this chain, the vital element is the producer who in this case is the local farmer. _x000D_
The Agricultural sector is faces with a number of highly complex problems which affect the chain system greatly. The Farmer is caught at a cross road since he/she has to suffer the consequences at a greater level than others within the chain. Agriculture is also wide and a lucrative business area individuals can invest in and make an income out of it.  _x000D_
To start, develop ,invest and grow the venture is an upheaval task since the field is also encompassed with disinformation. Entreprenuers therefore end up starting ventures that only make them incur loses at the end of the day. _x000D_
To try solve these challenges and strengthen this sector, the entreprenual idea I came up with is through the creation and invention of an Agricultural App that; _x000D_
1. Contains details concerning planting of Agricultural products._x000D_
2. Contains information concerning better farming practices._x000D_
3. Contains details on various Crop diseases and measures of combating these disease's._x000D_
4. Contains information concerning various types of seeds to plant with and those that ensure proper harvest._x000D_
5. Contains details on the amount of capital to be used to buy the seeds, start the venture and investments to be made as the business venture grows sporadically._x000D_
This app is also an all user app that can be used by every individual no matter the place or technological means one has at his disposal. The app is also linked to safaricom servers thus makes an individual access all this information easily through dialing particular numbers. This would be a great investment area since farmers would have concrete, factual, scientifically proven information at their disposal.
Business Customers:
_x000D_
The app targets individuals who want to venture into Agriculture as entreprenuers and the individual subsistence farmers._x000D_
For the individual subsistence farmers, the app will be able to increase their knowledge in agriculture to boost their production levels and be food sufficient. For entreprenuers the app is important to help them start enterprises agriculture related and make profits.
Product Solution:
The business app seeks to address the ain of the rise of misinformation pertaining the agricultural sector and the limited access to information from the already existing apps. This has been promoted due to : _x000D_
1. Presence of fake agribusiness apps._x000D_
2. Limited information within the already existing apps._x000D_
3. Most of the already existing apps don't focus on the geographical settings of particular areas thus pose a great challenge. _x000D_
4. A lack of diversity in the conveyance of information. I.e . Use of only a single language to air out information.
Business Challenge: I have not yet launched the business due to the lack of start up capital necessary to kick start the entire business operations.
Programme Benefit:
1. Availability of venture capital._x000D_
2. Creation of a wide market for the app._x000D_
3. Drawing in investments from different investors and investing companies._x000D_
4. Legislation processes.
Reffered By: Referred by someone, From National Youth Council, Press/Media Mention (newspaper, radio or TV) or Blog Article, Online Search (ie Google)
Programme Participation:
1. Promoting inclusivity in all youth related national affairs. Like competitions, conferences._x000D_
2. Advocating solutions to help deal with the issues around employment. Through instilling entrepreneurship skills to the youths._x000D_
Engamenet Ways: Voluntary work, Internships and work placements
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Civic Engagement, Creative Economy, Health, Environment, Agriculture
Programme Measures:
1. Educating more on entrepreneurship skills._x000D_
2. Organizing fair competitions covering a wide range of areas._x000D_

4. Developing co - curriculum activities sector to include every youth, male or female.

Name: Joseph Wagura
Field Interested: Economic/Enterprise Development, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Agriculture
Business Description: We deal in making non- carbonized charcoal briquettes. Non-carbonized briquettes serve as a replacement for natural firewood and raw biomass fuel. To get charcoal briquettes, we process crop residue such as coffee husk, sawdust, groundnut shell, rice husk and then we produce the briquettes.
Business Customers: We will serve institutions like hospitals, schools, hotels/restaurants and also households and this will be cost-effective as compared to the available sources of energy at the moment. Briquettes can save up to 50% cost as traditional charcoal burns fast and due to the ban on illegal charcoal production, the cost has since gone up thus making this commodity unaffordable to many people.
Product Solution:
Restaurants, e.g Nyama Choma Joints will definitely need a solution that will be affordable and emits no smoke. Briquettes burn for longer and this will be able to save a penny to businesses and consumers of our product._x000D_
_x000D_
We will have a cleaner environment as we will not cut down trees to produce charcoal briquettes. Also, we will have cleaner environments as no emissions are made by briquettes._x000D_
_x000D_
We will reduce unemployment as farmers will have an income by selling to us raw materials for briquettes production.
Business Challenge: Funding is the main issue. Selling briquettes requires marketing and explaining to customers how they work as many are not aware of the briquettes. For you to produce samples to go and pitch to the customers requires money which is a challenge to several start ups.
Programme Benefit: I would like to be supported in marketing so that the news of briquettes would be spread all over and people shift from traditional charcoal that involves cutting down trees and make charcoal from crop residues.
Programme Participation: Most youths are on social media.  National Youth council should use social media to communicate its message so that most youths are able to see and participate.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Creative Economy, Agriculture
Programme Measures: Forums should be held regularly and local youths be involved to mobilize fellow youths. This way coordination will be easy

Name: Kelvin Karani Njoroge
Business Description: On kuku farm, I rear poultry (both broilers and kienyeji), ducks and turkeys. I purchase the chicks from an agrovet as day old chicks and for the first two weeks they are fed with Suguna starter feeds. Vaccines are administered at days 7 (Newcastle), 14 (Gumboro) and 21 (Newcastle). From the second week, the chicks are fed on Suguna finisher feeds for the next four weeks till they attain an average weight of 1.8 kilogrammes. After a total of six weeks, the chicken is sold to the customers.
Business Customers: Currently, a large pool of kuku farm’s customers are hotels, as I supply them with their daily supply of fresh chicken meat, the smaller pool of customers are individuals in and around the neighborhood to whom I sell the chicken.
Product Solution: Kuku farm will solve the selling white meat that is naturally grown without food additives, or growth hormones to the consumers at a more affordable price than the average chicken bought in other markets and at the same time bringing closer the source of white meat closer to them.
Business Challenge:
The biggest challenge facing my business right now is the high prices of feeds that I buy from the agrovets, on average I spend more than half of my capital to `purchase the feeds alone. I have recently found out that rearing of black soldier flies as a source of feeds is a lot cheaper than buying commercial feeds and can be consumed by a wide range of animals including pigs, cats, dogs, fish etc._x000D_
_x000D_
`Another challenge would be the presence of brokers in the market who fluctuate the market prices: lowering the prices when many farmers have the chicken in an event where the market is flooded and increasing the prices when the demand outweighs the supply. This has tremendous effect on the farmer’s morale as most of the time the farmer is forced t break even in his business._x000D_
Programme Benefit:
By participating in the fursa vs economic recovery challenge I expect to learn problem-solving skills and transformation agenda to drive food security, inclusive economic growth and an agricultural revolution. I also expect to be trained on basic life skills, better understand production techniques and practical food value addition._x000D_
As a youth in Kenya, securing funds to expand my business has proven to be a real challenge. By participating in the programme, I will gain better understanding that facilitates access to capital and credit to run and expand my growing business by not only producing one type of white meat but rather a variety including fish and pork._x000D_
Programme Participation: By proving funding to start-ups, youth run small and medium projects and introducing mentorship programmes that will give the youths the know-how of starting and running a business, keeping up with the demands and current situations in the markets.
Programme Measures:
1.Promoting and strengthening permanent mechanisms of consultations with young people. The aim of furs the structured dialogue would be to deepen cooperation between the young people and policy makers, it also should strengthen consultations with young people and youth organizations at all levels so it will benefit all stakeholders: youth, youth organisations, youth researchers and policy makers._x000D_
2.Strengthening of information and consultation in the youth sector. A lot of youths find it hard getting information on uplifting their businesses due to a lack of information which reaches a few select. If there is an opportunity open to all youths then all the youths should be privy to the information through advertisements on radio or television which most youths use on a daily basis rather than posting the opportunities on the website. _x000D_

Name: Michael Owaga
Business Description:
Bowling will cost you about 350shillings per person per game and you can bowl alone or join a team and compete.  _x000D_
It will cost someone 550 per person per hour and during the weekends couples will be given a special offer of 900 per couples._x000D_
Next to the bowling arena pool tables,foosball and air-hockey should be nearby so that the people waiting not to be bored as there might be long queues before accessing the same. Bar and restaurant should be nearby in order for customers to be able to get software drinks readily and at favourable prices._x000D_
Payment can be through cash, via MPESA or via card. You’ll leave your shoes at the counter and handed a pair of bowling shoes. You should always remember to wear or carry a pair of socks. If you don’t you can purchase the same around the mall depending on the cost it is offered at. The wait time depends on the traffic and can be anything from 30 minutes to 1 hour._x000D_
There is a  bowling ball, there’s the bowling lane, there are 10 bowling pins and there’s a screen to keep score. Each bowler has 10 rounds (frames) which contain two rolls each._x000D_
In pin bowling, the goal is to knock over pins at the end of a lane, with two balls per frame allowed to knock down all pins. A strike is achieved when all the pins are knocked down on the first roll, and a spare is achieved if all the pins are knocked over on a second roll._x000D_
one point is scored for each pin that is knocked over. So if a player bowls over three pins with the first shot, then six with the second, the player would receive a total of nine points for that frame. If a player knocks down 9 pins with the first shot, but misses with the second, the player would also score nine. When a player fails to knock down all ten pins after their second ball it is known as an open frame. In the event that all ten pins are knocked over by a player in a single frame, bonuses are awarded._x000D_
At the counter, names are submitted  so that they may be entered in the system to maintain turns and keep score. The order of names/turns is not alphabetical but it is  as you list them during registration._x000D_
_x000D_
There’s no real ‘How To’ manual to read before you bowl. Just knock over as many pins at the end of the lane to beat your opponents.  The gutter must be avoided if a ball is to knock down any pins. If your ball enters a gutter, it goes on straight without knocking any pins and you get a zero. The bumper is a guard that prevents your ball from falling straight into the gutter._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
Business Customers: This service delivery will serve people from middle class and high class who are frequent users of shopping malls. Youths,children and even senior citizens can enjoy the same recreational facility since it does not involve any use of a lot of energy.
Product Solution:
It will serve as a top up  to the already existent sources of recreation that exist in the mood. The facility is non-existent in the co biggest mall in Kenya and someone has to go to Village Market in Gigiri and that is what will makes it lucrative._x000D_
Distance to get the same recreational facility will have been reduced hence reducing travel costs._x000D_
Overcrowding will be minimized in places that formerly offered the same recreational service,this will reduce chances of contracting airborne diseases; corona virus spread will also be reduced to some extent.
Business Challenge: Inadequate starting capital to make my business idea to be actualized. This is because the equipment are expensive to purchase and maintain.
Programme Benefit: I would love financial support since balling equipment is expensive to purchase. Start up capital to pay the rent for at least 3 months, salary for members of staff also inclusive.
Reffered By: Facebook post, Press/Media Mention (newspaper, radio or TV) or Blog Article, Online Search (ie Google)

Name: Derrick Waswa
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Civic Engagement, Creative Economy, Technology, Manufacturing, Education
Business Description:
Dorion Productions Class  focuses on creative video and theatrical content production. This programme aims to give youth all they need to become a digital producer of innovative theatre and media content which we know to be in high demand across a wide range of sectors.  Youth will be equipped with the skills, knowledge and behaviours to develop and pitch ideas for new and existing formats including YouTube, Instagram, Facebook and the countless other platforms used for transmitting and receiving content around the world today. Advanced digital skills in editing and VFX and a solid grounding in ‘digital first’ video production techniques (including cross channel storytelling, multi-camera, sound & lighting) stage and theatre shows is at the heart of the programme. Youth will be introduced to leadership, management and entrepreneurial practices and core principles of social media marketing to learn to identify, nurture, convert, track and retain audiences, build presence and encourage loyalty to brands and organisations.  They will be taught by industry experienced tutors through a combination of practical workshops and theory/concept based sessions and will be supported and enhanced by guest speakers, masterclasses, live briefs & work experience. As part of our work ready guarantee youth will have considerable opportunities to acquire work experience through industry placements and live briefs which are included in the programme. All students will be encouraged to engage in work placement and freelance opportunities as part of the programme as this remains an important element. Learners will complete a range of placements to broaden their skills base, experience and contacts and enhance their CV/Portfolio/Show reel in preparation for employment._x000D_
_x000D_
 The possible career paths after our training range from digital / creative content producers, media production assistant, creative communications producer, content editor, videographers, editors, art director, copywriter, researcher, marketing assistants, marketing co-ordinators, Opportunities for employment exist within a range of creative and marketing agencies as well as in-house marketing departments.
Business Customers: Our main client is  the youth.  Jobless or employed  youth. Above all, this training is for anyone with a passion for creating content for creative and digital media.  We shall train how one can  work effectively both individually and collaboratively as part of a team and be able to build and maintain positive relationships with staff, fellow youth and industry stakeholders. The general youth shall be shown how to acquire strong work ethic and commitment to producing the best quality, most engaging content around. By virtue of this, the course would suit anyone with a form four certificate or anyone  in: Media Production, Media Studies, Photography, Graphic Communication/Design, Animation, Fashion Business Retail or Fashion Marketing. There is the opportunity to continue your life long activities and work from what ever region as our studies on  Audio/Visual Production, Creative Enterprise, stage craft etc shall be online and some live.
Product Solution:
There are a number of problems that our product will help solve. Overall we shall create opportunities for employment, for both the educated and non educated. Aside from that the training will help companies and individuals acquire skill that will aid them manage their productions, companies and social media, including regular social media updates and engaging with people on their social media channels more professionally. _x000D_
_x000D_
News being a one touch feature, our training will allow graduates be able to manage blogs, including creating a relevant editorial calendar, writing articles and working as freelancers to create content. They can also be hired to run promotions, either on social media or at physical locations._x000D_
_x000D_
We also aim to solve problems  such as continuing education opportunities, networking and training that is unavailable to youth away from their normal 844 curriculum._x000D_
_x000D_
By this rigorous training, we shall aid learners acquire public speaking strengths, which will extend to including representing their company in public settings and preparing executives to speak at events such as news conferences._x000D_
Managing marketing materials, including brochures, newsletters and mailers._x000D_
_x000D_
Aside from that we shall be finding opportunities for advertising, whether in print, on TV or online._x000D_
Business Challenge:
Our main challenge is most  Kenyans put less value to this kind of technical training than university or college tertiary education. Parents and the community as a whole look down on such value based skills so many bright students often veer away from this trainings. Technically, we have  became the dumping ground for those whose academic capacity is not up to the requirements of higher learning. _x000D_
_x000D_
Lack of industry experience for many TVET teachers._x000D_
TVET institutions cannot really hire trainers from industry as their fees are much higher. Often, TVET institutions have to hire graduates of the Government teacher training institution._x000D_
_x000D_
In one country, the graduate of this type of training institution are sent to technical colleges each year regardless of the schools needs. These new teachers have few technical skills._x000D_
_x000D_
Hasty generalisation out of experience makes youth think one has to pass  not land them high-paying jobs. Whereas, TVET institutions offering courses relevant to the needs of the market are getting students working to support themselves in these courses. _x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
Equipment from previous investments are left idle due to the expensive trading supplies, no capacity to repair the imported equipment, and few knowing how to use it. Some of this equipment has already become relics of previous industrial requirements. _x000D_
_x000D_
We also face very little contribution from the private sector . The private sector would rather spend money to train their own workforce than look into such valuer based training. The end result is those private sectors end up receiving  the poor quality of the course offerings. _x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a challenge of finances. This training require some capital, and without it, managing the course becomes difficult. _x000D_
Programme Benefit:
We would appreciate a chance to be linked with industry technocrats from your end in order to be guided to the best direction regarding how to best make the trainings key and financially viable. Apart from that we are doing practical showcasing of our products live on stage and on screen and would appreciate if National Youth Council can come through as main sponsors. The benefits shall be mutual as both institutions will get desired publicity. _x000D_
_x000D_
Financial support would also come in handy for productions that we run recurrently.
Programme Participation:
Promoting conventional participation among young people, taking into account gender balance. It can also be done by ensuring the participation of young people is key to a successful and constructive involvement of young people in the life of society. _x000D_
_x000D_
Promoting and supporting unconventional initiatives  among young people. It is necessary to pay special attention to promoting awareness, inform young people and encourage their active participation in  already-established forms of initiatives :_x000D_
_x000D_
Promoting and strengthening permanent mechanisms of consultation with young people.  The aim of the structured dialogue is thus to deepen cooperation between young people and policy-makers. _x000D_
Promoting the importance of youth participation. _x000D_
_x000D_
Strengthening of information and consultation in the youth sector.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Creative Economy, Education
Programme Measures:
1. Include youth from the start_x000D_
_x000D_
In any youth engagement effort, young people should be involved in design and decision-making from the beginning. Even the most in-tune adult allies cannot understand youth needs as well as young people themselves. Partner with young people in all steps, from assessing your organisations readiness to designing an implementation plan. _x000D_
_x000D_
2. Develop a clear purpose and implementation plan_x000D_
_x000D_
Establishing goals and objectives up front will inform the format of your youth engagement activities, provide direction for program designers, define desired outcomes, and help you get buy-in from decision-makers. What are the expected results? _x000D_
_x000D_
3 Provide young people with meaningful roles_x000D_
_x000D_
Youth roles will vary depending on the implementation plan, but it is essential that young people are valued, empowered, and afforded an opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways._x000D_
_x000D_
4. Provide the right support and training_x000D_
_x000D_
While empowerment is a critical component of any youth engagement effort, this does not translate to a sink-or-swim approach. It is important to provide young people with the support they need to succeed, which may include training, mentorship, facilitation, coordination, and protection. _x000D_

Name: JOHN KENNEDY OTIENO
Field Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Civic Engagement, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Health, Environment, Manufacturing, Agriculture, Education
Business Description: Our business aims to improve access to mental health education and assistance to more sections of the population while simultaneously providing employment and training opportunities in the growing beauty, health, and well-being industry. Our focus is on the use of organic products in order to reduce our carbon footprint and minimize waste.
Business Customers: Our target clientele is the youth aged between 20- 33 years of age. Most people within this demographic are image-conscious therefore are more willing to spend money on cosmetic and beauty-related products and services. Similarly, this demographic faces a lot of challenges ranging from drug and substance problems, unplanned pregnancies, traumas from relationships, grief even single parenthood. We also aim to serve the LGBTQ community who struggle with discrimination and guilt over their sexuality and public perception of their lifestyles. Unfortunately, all these issues are stigmatized in large sections of our population as such, very few people have access to help and some that have access shun seeking it due to stigma.
Product Solution:
Our business will:_x000D_
1. Provide single parents with respite opportunities_x000D_
2. Provide clients with a safe space to discuss issues that are otherwise "taboo" in society with a _x000D_
    knowledgeable and understanding person_x000D_
3. Equip clients with resources to improve their physical and mental health._x000D_
4. Attend to clients' beauty and styling needs._x000D_
5.  Advise and educate clients on how to improve their overall well-being.
Business Challenge: Our biggest challenge currently is access to the start-up capital required to turn this concept into reality.  This is to cover the cost of Rent, Marketing and advertising, furnishing the space, website, and web hosting, and salaries for the initial quarter of the first year of operations. We also face the challenge of  staffing and training of our employees to make this a succesful and upscalable franchise.
Programme Benefit: I am seeking incubation services and access to start-up capital to see this project realized. I am however open to all kinds of assistance available in addition to on in lieu of the aforementioned.
Reffered By: Referred by someone, Word of Mouth

I however do look forward to engaging with you and providing feedback regarding this matter at a later time.

Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Value Character Development, Civic Engagement, Drug & Crime Free, Creative Economy, Health, Environment, Technology, Education

Name: Sammy Dzungovu Kavu.
Business Description: Mushroom production; Button type of mushroom. It's the type on demand in the market, with a market penetration of 95.2%.
Business Customers:
The greatest demand of mushrooms in the country is here in Nairobi. _x000D_
The Ministry of Health estimates that more that 100,000 deaths annually, are lifestyle related. Mushrooms contain antioxidants that help protect the body from damaging free radicals that can cause conditions like heart disease and cancer. _x000D_
_x000D_
From this information, the target population segment are the adults, above 35 years, who according to 2019 census are 12 million; 25% of the entire population. _x000D_
_x000D_
They tend to be more cautious about life, health is a crucial factor to them unlike the younger population, who hardly pay keen attention to their diet.
Product Solution:
According to the National Farmers Information Service [NAFIS], Kenya produces 500 tons of Mushrooms annually against the annual demand, standing at 1,200 tons. This is an enormous market niche. Kenya services this deficit by importing from Rwanda. This isn't an effective solution as the mode of transportation is by road. Mushrooms are highly perishable with little self life, hence once they arrive in the country the consumer product not only doesn't it taste good, but most of them have gone bad._x000D_
_x000D_
Nutritious Mushrooms been a local producer will firstly curb the high importation rate of Mushrooms. This will enhance the Nation's balance of trade and become one of the metrics of strengthening the Kenyan Currency and, the customers will have more mushrooms at lowered prices by KSH 100/=._x000D_
_x000D_
The local production capacity of filling the local market gap has the potential of creating 1,400 jobs. _x000D_
_x000D_
Rwanda also exports to the rest of East Africa. Kenya naturally has a competitive  edge over Rwanda in exporting in the East African region, boosted by the good regional integration of Kenya and her neighbors. This expansion will be a substantial recovery of the Kenyan Economy. as by exporting, it will generate diverse business opportunities to the citizens and gain added foreign exchange._x000D_
_x000D_
Business Challenge: Lack of funds.
Programme Benefit: I would highly appreciate financial aid from this reputable programme. I already have done my market research, found a suitable location within Nairobi, have a quotation from Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology( which is the only University in Kenya dealing with mushrooms), am about to take a three day mushroom course offered by the University; on handling mushroom farming as a business and I have completed my business plan.
Programme Participation:
In my opinion, National Youth Council should link the initiatives with a kind of reward to the youths upon completion._x000D_
 Recognition can be a good reward. Example if they participate in a certain initiative they can get a special kind of exposure such as an interaction with a prominent person, for instance a cabinet minister or an ambassador. Appearing in the newspaper too is a good enticement. _x000D_
_x000D_
Another way of encouraging the Youths is by allowing them to directly take part in the implementation processes, and having some latitude to do things as they see fit, under supervision.
Programs Interested: Skills Development, Economic/Enterprise Development, Creative Economy, Technology, Manufacturing, Agriculture
Programme Measures: So far I haven't noticed anything that needs to be improved.

Name: Vonnies Onkoba
Business Name: Ecosokoni Ukulima and Mazao Platform Ltd
Business Description:
Ecosokoni seeks to solve one of the most major challenges facing farmers in the country of lack of market. As Ecosokoni, we believe market is there for any farm produce provided it is food for consumption. That is why we provide a solution through our platforms such as the mobile application available in Google playstore and social media platforms. _x000D_
_x000D_
When going out to get market for farmers, we got to realise in most cases the producer hardly knows what the consumer wants. Take for example strawberries one of our major flagship products, it is common among consumers to complain of bitter strawberries in the market yet it is a fruit meant to be sweet._x000D_
_x000D_
Through this we realised we also need to be involved in production to show farmers on how to produce quality yields.
Business Customers:
Our business seeks to serve both small scale farmers in accessing market and agronomic support and consumers seeking for food sources they can trust._x000D_
_x000D_
We have a special focus on youth farmers and seek to encourage more in joining the field. _x000D_
Product Solution: Traceability if what we consume is not common in Kenya. Our business seeks to connect the farmer on ground and the consumer. We want to show the consumer whatever that goes to their body where it comes from and how it is produced.
Business Challenge: A reliable delivery system. As a start-up with no clear delivery channel in place, we are forced to use public means such as matatus to deliver to our customers. Most times we are affected with traffic and end up not managing all food deliveries. Bearing in mind we are dealing with fresh farm produce, at times we are forced to discard due to being unable to deliver .
Programme Benefit:
I would love to network with more youth entrepreneurs within the program. We may be able to collaborate in one way or another as we seek to creating more opportunities for our youths in the country._x000D_
Financial support if any to help us as a start-up to continue reaching more and more farmers.
Programme Participation: Youths in most cases associate well with success. NYC can showcase some of the successful youths who have passed through them and are now very successful to attract more.
Programme Measures: Tapping into the power of social media. Most youths are active in social media. If they come across initiatives done by NYC, interesting initiatives they would definitely love to be part of it.

Name: Martin Kiyeng
Business Description:
Development of solar powered smart refilling reusable packaging & IoT connected dispensers with supply chains to change FMCG consumption & plastic packaging waste._x000D_
_x000D_
We identify the fastest moving consumer goods products that are safest and simplest to distribute via IoT connected vending machines that dispense into smart reusable packaging. Promoting behavioral change incentivizing reuse and recycling._x000D_
Business Customers:
Urban poor low income population and business men. We targets low-income markets where affordability is everything. Meaning customers with limited incomes are offered an opportunity to purchase smaller sized portions for the lowest possible bulk prices. Our convenient distribution system can greatly outcompete sachets and other small format packaging on the per unit cost of products. In addition to offering economically inclusive consumption, we also enable low-resource customers to decouple product consumption from packaging waste._x000D_
_x000D_
We aim at creating a new retail ecosystem of product refilling
Product Solution:
Mismanaged single-use plastic bottles are creating a worldwide crisis. Single-use bottles account for 14% of plastic waste (Plastic Oceans 2019). Single-use bottles are especially problematic in low-income community as the region often lacks effective waste management systems and many regions have heavy seasonal rains that disperse plastic waste._x000D_
The root problem with single-use bottle pollution (and other plastic packaging) is that single-use plastic is inexpensive and convenient. A promising solution that can eliminate the need for ~1/5 of the world’s single-use plastic are innovative reusable packaging distribution systems. We aim at reducing the need for single-use packaging by offering inclusive distributed network of franchised solar powered smart reusable re-fillers dispensers that changes consumption that maximizes convenience while minimizing product cost on an issue of ‘Poverty tax’ where people pay for packaging instead of the product packaging _x000D_
Reusable distribution systems can offer excellent convenience and cost-savings-the most critical variables to motivate consumers to embrace reusable packaging opportunities. Once we have created demand and awareness of Re-Plastic re-usable packaging distribution system, we will be well positioned to motivate consumers to embrace re-usable packaging distribution system for a wider range of products through refilling._x000D_
Business Challenge:
One of our biggest challenges is trying to shift consumption habits from single-use to reuse. This complex cultural change requires support from diverse and powerful networks of aligned stakeholders._x000D_
_x000D_
Another key challenge is adoption chain risk. The brand partners using our distribution system will need to adopt to our innovation sufficiently so that the full value proposition of our distribution system is clearly understood by customers. _x000D_
_x000D_
There is also co-innovation risk in that we are pulling together diverse retailers, technology providers, governments and investors and all these stakeholders need to work together optimally and efficiently to optimize the value creation of Replastic and their brand partners distribution system.
Programme Benefit: Piloting , Business Model development,  Technology development,  Distribution , Funding and revenue model , Talent acquisition, Legal advice and consideration, Media and speaking opportunities
Reffered By: Referred by someone, From National Youth Council
Programme Participation: Addressing opportunity inequality by decentralizing opportunities which only exist in major cities but also funding innovative ways of expanding the same. Also encourage youth to build industries that is local problem but with an international out look. Encouraging youth to participate or build business that create an eco-system and solve everyday social injustices to be inclusive. Not projects but self sustaining businesses.
Programme Measures: Having a multi facet approach to all the stakeholders both state, non state and the private sector in addressing youth challenges. One sided approach wouldn't be sustaining
